loans.name: Fatou Baidy

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Baidy, une femme de la soixantaine d’année, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle vend des tissus et divers autres produits demandés par sa clientèle et dont la vente peut générer un bénéfice. Elle compte sa clientèle parmi son voisinage et des parents proches qui habitent à Thiès, la région départementale ; quand elle a de la marchandise, elle part jusque là bas pour vendre et récupérer ses dettes. Madame Fatou Baidy est veuve et mère de famille, elle est aidée par ses enfants dans la dépense quotidienne. Et grâce au crédit, elle aimerait améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Elle pense à la réfection de sa maison et à y loger tout ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou Baidy, a woman around 60 years of age, has been working as a vendor for over five years. She sells fabric and other popular merchandise that can bring in a revenue. Her clients are her neighbors and relatives living in Thiès. When she has merchandise for sale, she travels there to resell and recover her investment. Mrs. Fatou Baidy is a widow with children. He children help her with everyday expenses. Thanks to this loan, she would like to improve her family’s nutrition.

She is thinking of renovating her house in order to have space for all her children there.

loans.use: to buy fabric and miscellaneous items for resale.

loans.name: Julius' Group

texts.en:
Abangonya is a group of nine group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Julius selected as the Kiva representative. Julius has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and he is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to Julius and the 87 individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 shillings.							

Julius is a reliable member of the community. He is married, with six children. He is 48 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last ten years to support his family. Julius is also known as Pastor. In addition to this, Julius is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group.  He described his harvest last year as being good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Julius’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and he has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and earn enough money to feed his family. As an active member in his community, Julius also chose to be a group leader and a Kiva representative because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers, and he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Julius plans on using the future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to buy a cow. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from the harvest, he has more farm training, he was able to save money, and he was able to feed the family.							

Julius and the Abangonya Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers, as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase his harvest of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jessiely

texts.en: Jessiely  is studying at Saint Vincent College, taking courses toward a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, with a Major in Financial Management. She finds ways to help her parents and without hesitation, she joined GDMPC. She has borrowed a loan, with which she will pay tuition and fees for her second semester. She hopes to continue her studies and wants to find a better career in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition and fees

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia helps her husband  to earn a living by selling fish in town. She has been in this business for many years, earning enough for their daily needs. 

From her profit, she has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to buy fishing nets. Recently, she requested a new loan to repair her fishing boat to improve her business. All she wants is to repair their own house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Niel

texts.en: Niel is studying toward a BS in Business Administration - Financial Management, at Saint Vincent College. He wants to become successful someday, to help his parents. Niel joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan, which he will use to pay tuition and fees for the second semester. He dreams of having his own business in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition and fees

loans.name: Dibanith

texts.es:
Ella es dibanith,  proveniente de fundación (Magdalena) tras el apoyo familiar decidió intentar suerte en Bogotá, llego a trabajar como niñera, empleada doméstica.
Actualmente estudia servicios farmacéuticos para generar una formación Profesional y superación Personal y así conseguir un buen empleo para ayudar a la familia económicamente.
Vive con un primo y la Esposa del primo, a futuro quiere seguir estudiando “Regencia” y capacitarse día a día. 
Tiene 31 años, por eso la solicitud al Convenio KIVA para ayudar a esta mujer a terminar la carrera técnica y cumplir los sueños y metas, el lema es “Querer es Poder”
texts.en:
Her name is Dibanith. She is originally from Fundación (Department of Magdalena). Thanks to her family’s support, she decided to try her luck in Bogotá [the capital city of Colombia] working as a babysitter and housekeeper.

She is currently studying to become a pharmacist, because she wants to be a professional, grow as a person and find a good job in order to financially support her family.

She lives with a cousin and his wife. In the future, she would like to study Administration and improve every day more.

She is 31 years old and this is why she is requesting a loan through the agreement with Kiva. She is looking for help to finish her studies and reach her goals. Her motto is “where there’s a will, there’s a way.”

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees of one semester.

loans.name: Justina Emperatriz

texts.es: Justina Emperatriz mayor de edad soltera, originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietaria de una pulpería donde ofrece productos de granos básicos, golosinas, productos congelados, café, shampoo, papel higiénicos, sopa maggi, detergentes, huevos, sopas maruchan, salsas de tomates, toallitas sanitarias entre otras, al igual que también se dedica a la compra venta de ropa de niños y ropa interior, sus compras son al contado, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, con muchos deseos de superación personal, ella poco a poco ha salido adelante en esta ocasión esta Solicita el crédito para comprar más productos y aumentar su inventario. Su mayor sueño es invertir más para poder mejorar su negocio. Justina Emperatriz agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Justina Emperatriz is an older woman who is single.  She is originally from Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country.  Justina is the owner of a store where she offers products such as basic grains, snack foods, frozen products, coffee, shampoo, toilet paper, bouillon cubes, detergents, eggs, ramen noodle soups, tomato sauce, sanitary wipes, and other items.  In addition, she sells children's clothing and undergarments.  Her purchases are made with cash.  

Justina is known as an enterprising woman who has the drive to succeed on a personal level.  As a result, she has been able to get ahead a little bit at a time.  On this occasion, Justina is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products to increase her inventory.  Her greatest wish is to invest more so that she can improve her business.  

Justina Emperatriz is very appreciative of the support from the Kiva lenders who have availed themselves to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy household products to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer living in Kericho, a very rich and fertile area for agriculture. He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has practiced farming for the past eight years. He produces and sells milk and eggs. He enjoys dairy farming the most, as it yields more income for him. His biggest challenge is lack of enough dairy feed.

Peter chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because of their low interest rate and easy payment methods. During the training he came to understand that Juhudi loans to farmers in groups of 15 members. This loan will help Peter purchase a chaff cutter, which will enable him to get animal feed easily. His livestock will produce more milk, thus increasing his income. This will enable him to give his children a better education and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a simple farmer from the village of Mabangug. He has managed a farming business for several years. According to him, sometimes he had to struggle with his farming business due to weather conditions. Despite these conditions, he still had his strong determination to face any challenges from his farming business because of the help of his family and children. 

Now, he would like to ask for additional capital of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. He knows that it will help him a lot, especially in attaining his dreams in life. Jovito hopes this loan will help him to have a better way of life and secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
Raúl, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, con el fin de dar a su familia lo mejor instalo una tienda por iniciativa propia, la cual atiende de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., no posee ayuda de familiares en el extranjero.
Invertirá en la compra de golosinas, bebidas, pan, entre otros productos que son necesarios para dar una buena a tensión a sus clientes; espera aumentar sus ventas, tener un negocio fortalecido, y obtener mejores ganancias con las que podrá cancelar la deuda adquirida, así como también dar un estilo de vida diferente a su familia.
Anhela mantener su negocio activo, para ir mejorando poco a poco su entorno familiar.
texts.en: Raúl is the father of an 8-year-old and a 12-year-old.  In order to do what is best for his family, he opened a store on his own initiative where he works from 6:00AM to 4:00PM.  He doesn't have family members abroad who can assist him.  He will buy snacks, drinks, breads, and other products which are necessary to provide a good service for his customers.  He hopes to increase his sales, have a stronger business, and increase his profits, which will allow him to pay off the loan as well as to give his family a different lifestyle.  He wants very much to keep his shop open so he can improve his family environment over time.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, breads, and other products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est une femme de 45 ans commerçante. Elle  fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 7 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un pick up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joséphine, age 45, is a merchant. For the past seven years, she's been retailing fresh food products (cassava, plantains, palm nuts, and fruits) according to the season, in one of her town's markets.

She's very familiar with suppliers, and especially her clientele, which she acquired over time thanks to her experience in this field. But she finds herself constantly out of stock, because she has no choice but to sell everything before being able to resupply, due to the smallness of her working capital.

She would like to buy a truckload of plantain bunches, in order to build a good stock, which will enable her to better meet the constant demand from her customers and avoid running out of stock.

She will put away her profits in order to expand her business and also provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains

loans.name: Lenard

texts.en:
Very hardworking and responsible, Lenard is a married man who lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past two years, Lenard has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business, providing service to town dwellers. He cites the high cost of maintenance as his major challenge. 

With this Kshs 20,000, Lenard wants to purchase spare parts and paint for his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ruwa

texts.en:
Ruwa is a very hardworking and responsible man. He lives in the coastal region of Kenya. 

For the past two years, he has operated a clothes-selling business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites seasonality as being his major challenge. 

With the KES 40,000 loan,  he wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Saveeri

texts.en:
Saverio is an agicultural crop farmer, and he is also involved in small animal farming. He started his business in 1993 to sustain his family. He would like to add manure to his gardens and also buy seedlings. His customers are basically wholesalers. 

In the future he hopes to raise cattle, because it is less risky than crop farming with its uncertain weather. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a responsible mother who helps her husband in generating income. She engages herself in cooking and selling meals and snacks near the school campus. She is 33 years old and has two children. Maribel aims to make her business more profitable in order to support the education of her children and provide their daily necessities. 

Due to insufficient capital, she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fresh meat, dressed chicken, vegetables and ingredients needed to be cooked and sold. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business which will enable her to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, dressed chicken, vegetables and ingredients needed for her food production business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. Apart from selling office products, he also prints T-shirts and sells them to his customers. He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more ink and plain T-shirts for his business. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more ink and plain T-shirts for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, wood, nails, and other supplies for building a roof.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alicia de 37 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de calzado de niños y de adultos. Actividad que la desempeña en un lugar específico de la localidad, desde hace ocho años. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería. En objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de diferente estilo para aprovechar la temporada navideña.  Alicia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old and a single mother to two adult children.  She is originally from the central area of Nicaragua. Alicia is a hard-working woman and has a desire to do better than before.  In her spare time she likes to enjoy the company of her family. Unfortunately, Alicia could not study at university and had to work from a young age in order to help pay the household bills.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to prosper, Alicia works selling footwear for adults and children.  She has been working at a local place for eight years, working ten hours per day selling her merchandise. The aim for this loan is to invest in working capital and buy various styles of children's and adults' footwear in order to take advantage of the Christmas season.  Alicia is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping poor people to have a decent job and for helping poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy various styles of children's and adults' footwear.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money from her salon business.  

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her personal expenses. This loan of KES 40,000 that she is requesting will help her to purchase hair rollers, hair oil, shampoos and braids for her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair rollers, hair oil, shampoos and braids for her business.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
La señora Deysi  de 45  años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene un  hijo  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Deysi tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras, también vende cosméticos ya que su esposo se dedica a esta actividad y le apoya económicamente  sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan y también los miembros de su iglesia.
Doña Deysi sus clientes, doña Deisy es una mujer trabajadora y bien humilde tiene muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su hijo menor que está estudiando.
Doña Deysi está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra  de plásticos como pailas, baldes, vasos, platos, cremas, perfumes, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, etc. ya que tiene estos negocios con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
Doña Deysi su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Deysi is 45 years old, lives with her husband and dependent son in the San Lorenzo community, in the southern Honduras valley.

Deysi has had a home of her own for the past five years and sells groceries, fresh food, and vegetables.  She also sells cosmetics and so does her husband, who helps her financially.  Her friends, people from her church, and others who visit her daily are her customers.

Deysi is a hardworking and very humble lady with a great desire for getting her young son ahead.  He attends school.

Deysi is asking for a loan to buy plastic items such as pails, cups, and plates; also creams, perfumes, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, etc.  She has these businesses and plans to improve her income with support from this loan.  This will be her fourth loan through Prisma.

Deysi wants to make improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2013.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter tiene 23 años, vive en casa familiar con su esposa e hijo. Desde hace 2 años, trabaja manejando una mototaxi, el cual le permite solventar los gastos de su familia. Ha estado ahorrando para comprarse una mototaxi. Beneficiario utilizará el crédito para completar el pago de la mototaxi. Su sueño es comprarse un carro para hacer taxi y con ello incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 23 years old and lives in a house with his wife and child.  For the past two years, he has worked by driving a motorcycle taxi.  This has allowed him to pay for his family's expenses.  He has been saving toward the purchase of a motorcycle taxi.  

Walter will use this loan to complete the payment of a motorcycle taxi.  His dream is to buy a car that he can use as a taxi so that he can increase his earnings and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to complete the payment of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Samuel Isaac

texts.es:
Samuel, es un joven soltero, vive con su madre a la cual ayuda en económicamente con los gastos de su hogar, para obtener los ingresos se dedica a cultivar maíz y realiza trabajos de estructuras metálicas, atiende su negocio de lunes a sábado, se organiza de una forma en la que pueda cumplir con ambas actividades.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, hierro y laminas, con lo que podrá sembrar maíz sin ningún inconveniente y contara con los materiales para trabajar en las estructuras metálicas, espera fortalecer su negocio, incrementar sus ganancias y cumplir a tiempo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Aspira tener un negocio mucho más rentable y dar una mejor alimentación, salud a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is a young, single man.  He lives with his mother, whom he helps with household costs.  In order to earn a living Samuel works growing corn and also does metalwork.  He works from Monday to Saturday and organises his time so that he can do both his farming and craft work.

Samuel will invest this loan in manure, anti-plague treatments, weedkillers, iron, and laminate metal sheeting.  He will then be able to sow corn without any problems, and he will have the materials for his metalwork.  Samuel hopes to strengthen his business, increase his profits, and fulfil his customers' orders.

Samuel aspires to having a much more profitable business and to providing for his family so that they have better food and better health.

loans.use: to buy manure, anti-plague treatments, weedkillers, iron, and laminate metal sheeting.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a hard-working woman, married, and she has four school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mbeyu has operated a coconut-selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 Mbeyu is requesting, she wants to purchase more sacks of coconuts for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 53 years old, from Batumi city. She lives with her son, who is unemployed nowadays. Her main economic activity is the newly-started clothing store, where various types of used clothing are sold. Her project is profitable but it needs support for further development. 

Liana decided to expand her business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Liana received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, called Start-up Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 3,000 USD, she will purchase stock of used clothing for expanding her activities. Liana believes that the project will be lucrative. Her regular customers will be locals and passersby as well. Liana will serve her clients as saleslady and work hard to increase turnover gradually. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Ipasalu Group

texts.en: Arminda is one the members of the Ipasalu Group. The word "Ipasalu" means "Hope" in their local language. She is taking a loan to add to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies, such as cigarettes, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar and water. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $50.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, salt, noodles, coffee, sugar and water.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 38-year-old housewife who is married to Robi in the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is illiterate and knows to sign her name only, but her children are studying in different classes of a village school. Amongst them, one is involved in a fish business.

Minati is a housewife and her husband is running a business selling meat in the market. As the extracted animal skin is left unused, Minati decided to make leather from the skin of different animals and sell the skins to leather factories for making leather bags, jackets, shoes and various types of things. She wants to start this business because she knows she will achieve an additional profit which will enable them to spread their business widely and to give more support to her family. She is taking out the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more animals to produce leather in large quantity for sale. She is glad to have BJS and Kiva to help her with funding.

loans.use: To buy more animal  skins to start her new leather business

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is 27 years old, a married woman with two children. Her children are receiving an education; her son is in class V (Grade 5) and her daughter is in class IV (Grade 4). She and her husband both are illiterate but can sign their names. 

They have a small plantation where they grow different vegetables in different seasons and sell those vegetables in the local market. She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. So, she has applied for this loan to BJS to buy tomato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating tomatoes.

Safina will use the profits from sales to increase her business, support her family, and pay for her children’s education. She thanks BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating tomatoes.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is 34 years old, living with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district. 

She has been working as a construction worker in the village. Having been in this business for 17 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the third loan for Sim with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy construction supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband's name is Sunil and he is 33 years old. Mamani studied up to class IX (grade 9). Her husband is a young entrepreneur from a farming family and involved in agriculture. They have their own kaccha (Straw and mud-made) house in a small village called Gobinda Nagar in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Mamani works hard every day, from the early morning. She also helps her husband with cultivation yet she is unable to give financial support to her family, as the earnings of her husband are not sufficient to maintain their household expenses. She has applied for the loan to purchase seeds of paddy and good quality fertilizers and pesticides for farming. This will help her to improve the financial condition of her family. Both Mamani and her husband want to give a proper education to their child.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy (rice).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy body lotion, fish, noodles, bread and oils.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hard-working woman. Victoria is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past six years, Victoria has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, in which she designs clothes through sewing.

To help expand her business, Victoria has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to purchase more material and thread. This will help Victoria to generate greater profits and expand the business. Victoria hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her sales and start a training school.

Victoria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more material and thread

loans.name: Cinthia Carolina

texts.es: Cinthia Carolina, mayor de edad casada originaria de uno de los municipios Chinandega ubicado al  norte del occidente del país, es propietaria de un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece servicios de: aplicación de tintes, cortes de cabello para damas, caballero y niños, manicura, puesta de uñas acrílicas, entre otros al igual que vende productos de cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas faciales, shampoo, perfumenes,  tintes, cremas alisadoras, entre otras más, sus compras son al contado en el municipio de Chinandega, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y en algunas ocasiones a clientes eventuales, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de productos o materia prima para su salón de belleza e invertir en cosméticos, para aprovechar las fiestas navideñas que es cuando más crece su demanda de clientes,  uno de sus sueños es poder tener una estructura adecuada en su salón y los accesorios necesarios para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Cinthia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Cinthia Carolina is an adult woman who is married.  She is originally from one of the townships of Chinandega, which is located in the northwestern part of the country.  Cinthia is the owner of a small beauty salon located in her home.  There she offers services such as hair coloring, manicures, acrylic nail application, and haircuts for women, men, and children.  She also sells beauty products such as makeup, facial crèmes, smoothing crèmes, and other items.  Her purchase are made with cash in the town of Chinandega.  The transactions with her established and occasional walk-in customers are conducted in cash or on credit.  

The purpose of this loan is to use it as operating capital for buying products and supplies for her beauty salon.  She will also invest in cosmetics so that she can take advantage of the Christmas festivities when there is more demand from her customers.  One of her dreams is to have an adequate place for her salon and all the necessary accessories that will allow her to provide better service to her customers.  

Cinthia is extremely grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders who avail themselves to people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
With her determination to live comfortably, Nieves helps her husband generate income to uplift their living condition. Nieves is living happily with her husband and one child.

Nieves is engaged in selling grocery items while her husband manages their crop production. She was able to repair their small house with income earned from her general store business. Now, she could say that she's enjoying the fruits of her sacrifices. Her aim now is to finish upgrading her house and educating her child. To help achieve her goal, Nieves is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy grocery items, medicines, and drinks. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted for her to increase her income, satisfy her customers' demand and make the business a viable source of her family's income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, medicines, and drinks for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas and winter season items, especially sweets, juices, and detergent

loans.name: Aridiatou

texts.fr:
ARIDIATOU est âgée de 44 ans, elle vit dans une grande famille dans la ville  de Koutiala. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études, d’où son attachement aux activités commerciales. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, présentement elle s’est basée sur  la vente d’aliments (cantine scolaire).  Pour  pouvoir constituer un stock de matières premières (farine de blé, huile, pomme de terre,…) et  augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, elle décide de  rejoindre l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt  elle compte acheter  5 sacs de farine, 40litres d’huile et 2 sacs de pomme de terre. Elle  effectue son activité au lycée public de Koutiala à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte  réaliser un profit de 90.000FCFA par mois, qu’elle utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans  son activité.
texts.en:
Aridiatou is 44 years old, she lives in a large family in the town of Koutiala. She was not lucky enough to continue her studies, which is why she is very attached to her commercial activities. Having had several professions, she now sells food products (school canteen). In order to constitute a stock of basic products (flour, oil, potatoes) and increase her revenue, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, the micro-finance institution, from whom she requests her first loan.
With this loan she plans to buy five bags of flour, 40 litres of oil, and two sacks of potatoes. She sells her products at the public high school in Koutiala to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make a profit of 90.000FCFA per month that she will use to pay back the interest on the loan from Soro Yiriwaso, provide for her needs, and invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: To buy food products for catering.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source  of his income.
Joaquin is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seeds and a sprayer. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Ma. Lucena

texts.en:
Maria Lucena raises crops. She has been raising crops for more than eight years while her husband earns an income through fishing. 

She earns enough income from her garden for their daily needs and has successfully repaid the previous loan used for her farm. 

Recently, Maria Lucena borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer in order to improve her farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children.

She runs a piggery while her husband is working as plumber. She has been in her business for more than ten years and she earns well for the family. 

She joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to buy feeds and other items to maintain her pigs. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business for a better living.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other items to maintain her pigs.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio, es un campesino de 34 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 11 años. Trabaja como mayordomo en una finca ubicada en el oriente antioqueño y en sus días libres se dedica a trabajar como aserrador de manera independiente, talando árboles con el debido permiso y, la madera es comercializada en el municipio donde reside; alternando ambas actividades logra generar los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia. Buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitieran salir adelante, encontró en el crédito una buena opción para lograrlo, por ello solicita el apoyo, pues con el dinero podrá comprar una motosierra con la que podrá ejercer su actividad independiente de una manera más ágil, lo que le permitirá optimizar el tiempo y generar mejor rentabilidad. Sergio con el ánimo de sacar adelante su familia, sigue luchando incansablemente, trabajando arduas jornadas siempre con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo crecer, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable y así brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sergio, a 34 year-old countryman, is married and the father of an 11 year-old son. He manages a farm located in eastern Antioquia. On his days off he works as an independent sawyer, cutting down trees with the proper permit. The wood is sold in the municipality where he lives. With both of these sources of work he manages to generate enough resources to support his family.

Looking for new alternatives that would help him get ahead, he found that a loan was a good option so he is requesting this support. With the money he will be able to buy a power saw and carry out his independent work more easily. This will allow him to make optimum use of his time and higher profits.

Sergio, intent on providing for his family, continues to fight tirelessly. He works arduous days, always with the objective of strengthening and growing his business in order to ensure economic stability, afford a better quality of life for his family and a better education for his son.

loans.use: to buy a power saw.

loans.name: Tumsifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Kamana est une commerçante depuis 15 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires « Tumsifu », âgée  de 37 ans et mère de 7 enfants, dont  6 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse d’haricots et maïs. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter 6 sacs d’haricots et 4 sacs de maïs pour accroitre son activité. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire à DHL dans la ville. Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs en leur octroyant de crédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kamana has been a trader for fifteen years, and is a member of the business group 'Tumsifu'.  She is 37 years old and mother to seven children.  Six of her children attend school and one is still too young to attend.  

Kamana sells beans and maize.  She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, and she will use her loan to buy six sacks of beans and four sacks of maize, to help grow her business.  Kamana's husband works for DHL in the town, and she started her business with money provided by him.

In the future, Kamana hopes to buy a plot of land, build a house, feed and educate her children.  She would like to thank Hekima for the support, and the unguaranteed loans that they provide to small entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of beans and 4 sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Julienne est une commerçante d’une expérience de 15 ans, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires  «  Ahadi ». Elle est vendeuse de friperie(surtout femmes). Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, devenir grossiste et scolariser tous ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment difficile de conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Julienne is a 35-year-old, trader, with fifteen years experience in her business.  She is mother to seven children, who all attend school.  

Julienne is a member of the business group, 'Ahadi'.  She sells second-hand clothing, particularly to women.  She has requested this loan in order to invest in her business, and she will use her loan to buy a parcel of second-hand clothing for resale.  Julienne's husband is also a trader, and she began her business with money she received from him.

In the future, Julienne hopes to expand her business, become a wholesaler and ensure the education of all her children.  She would like to thank the field partner, Hekima, for the support and loans that they offer to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, during this difficult period of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria tiene 49 años es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su hermana y su mamá a la cual tiene que cuidar porque es mayor de edad, su principal actividad es la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con buena cantidad de ganado lechero y sus productos los entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos. Actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de forraje, ya que tiene que acumularlo en grandes cantidades para prever la temporada de sequía en la cual el precio del mismo se incrementa. De esta forma podrá seguir produciendo y obteniendo ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is 49 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives with her sister and her elderly mother who she has to care for.  Her main business activity is producing raw milk.  Her dairy cows are of good quality and she delivers her output to a company that makes dairy products.  

Victoria is currently requesting a loan in order to buy fodder, which she accumulates in large quantities so that she does not have to pay higher prices during the dry season.  This will allow her to continue producing and generating the income she needs to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labour to pick the coffee beans and clear the property of weeds.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by farming rice and raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is single. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her parents. 

To help for a living, she runs a business where she prepares peanut butter and she sells it at the town market. She earns so well from this that she had to plan to expand her business. 

Estela borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy raw ingredients in order to gain more customers and profit, as well. 

In the future, she wants to be successful in her business, to have a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her peanut butter business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married, with one child. He runs a service-based business, providing motor transportation in his community. He has been doing this for sixteen years, earning well for the family. 

Alex joined GDMPC and has requested a new loan to buy new tires for his vehicle. Alex always finds ways to improve his family's living conditions. In the future, he wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 45 years old and married, with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Margie has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. She has been able to improve her business over the years and also improved her family living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh 35,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married, with four children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and she also earns an income from selling personal products.

Marissa aspires to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of two children, living in the rich highlands of Kericho. She is an established farmer and has practiced farming for 25 years, where she produces milk, eggs, and tea. She enjoys poultry farming the most, but her challenge is disease outbreaks in the poultry. 

Margaret chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low-interest rates on their loans, their services are very good, and they have an easy repayment mode. This loan will enable Margaret to purchase poultry feed for her poultry and they will produce more eggs for family consumption and for sale. This will increase her income base and, thus, enable her to cater to other farming projects and also improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en:
Sivan, 43, is married and has four children residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. 

To support the family, she has been farming rice for 24 years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about US $7 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sivan has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loan, which has helped her better support her family’s needs. Now she is requesting an education loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Agnellah

texts.en:
Agnellah owns a house in Voi, Kenya that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food . 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking man who lives at the coastal region of Kenya.

David sells food such as salt, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more stock for resale. He joined Yehu to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food for resale.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: Don Gabino  es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, de 60 años de edad. Casado y padre de tres hijos. Es de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y trigo. Inicio sus actividades hace muchos años; trabajaba como obrero y con el dinero obtenido iba ahorrando poco a poco. Tiempo después se fue dedicando a la cosecha de maíz y trigo. Actualmente cuenta con casa propia y con una siembra creciente. Su meta próxima es iniciar el corte de trigo y maíz. Solicita el crédito para pagar salario al personal que realiza el corte y empacado de trigo.  Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para realizar el corte de trigo. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
60-year old Sr. Gabino is a native of the town of Boaco. He is married and has three children. He has earned his living growing corn and wheat for many years. He started out as a labourer and gradually saved some of the money he earned. Then some time later he began farming. Now he has his own house and an increasing amount of land.

Gabiano’s next challenge is to harvest the wheat and corn. He is seeking a loan to pay labourers to cut and pack the wheat. He believes that the money will help him greatly to harvest his crop. In the future he hopes to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: pay labourers to cut and pack wheat

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en: Raheli is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Doña Sara es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 63 años de edad. Madre soltera de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Inicio sus actividades hace varios años; con dinero que tenía ahorrado y ha ido creciendo poco a poco en el negocio. su meta próxima es poseer un tramo propio para lograr vender sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: lencería, pantalones, camisetas y pacas de ropa usada entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con su venta de ropa, mejorar su casa y comprar electrodomésticos. Su plan futuro es ahorrar dinero y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
63-year old Sra. Sara is a native of the town of Boaco. She is the single mother of three grown-up children. Sara runs a business selling new and used clothing, a job she has been doing for several years. She saved money and slowly invested it in the business. Her next goal is to have a place of her own where she can sell her products.

Sara is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as underwear, pants, shirts, bundles of used clothing etc. She believes that the loan money will help greatly with her wish to expand her business, make improvements to her house, and buy electrical appliances. Her plan for the future is to save money and renovate her house.

loans.use: buy underwear, pants, shirts, bundles of used clothing etc.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, aged 27, is living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has two children. 

She and her husband have been farming rice and growing pineapples and beans. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. Sometimes, her husband earns additional income for the family by working for others for a fee.
 
Vanny is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 38, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been selling grocery items. Sophea has been in business for 12 years.
 
Sophea has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. Now she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 49-years old lady; she is passing her life with her four sons and three daughters.

She is taking a loan for purchasing material for embroidery by hand. In fact, her whole family is involved in this business. All of them are very expert in their professions and make very fine bridal dresses at home.

Due to demand, they are facing a shortage of material and unable to do fine embroidery. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can reduce the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount, she will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Golngai Lom Group

texts.en:
Golngai Lom group is formed of eighteen women who reside in a village which is about 40 kms from Imphal town in Manipur which is one of the northeastern states in India. Nengneilhing is one of the group members who runs a variety shop in the village. She is the profiled member for the group and she is pictured with her hand raised.

Nengneilhing generates income for the family by running a variety shop in a village. The village is about 4 and 1/2 kms from the district town and one has to pay rs.20 to the auto rickshaw driver as the fare to reach the village. She sells small sachets of shampoo, detergent powder, detergent bar soap, onions, garlic, potatoes, cereals etc. Essential needs are sold in the shop as villagers cannot travel to the town market for small items like matches and candles. She usually gets the supplies from the town or at the capital market. The generated income is small and insufficient to manage the family expenses and also to stock a large variety of supplies.

With the loan, she will purchase more cereals, first aid kits and drugs for common illnesses like coughs, diarrhea, and fever. The village is located in a remote place from the town which is a hurdle for easy access to everyday activities, for which reason she is inspired to become the most successful supplier for essential goods in the village. She is glad that Kiva will be supporting the group which is a big happiness for them since they usually get the working capital for their businesses from money lenders at high interest. She says “Thank you so much, Kiva, and God bless you all!"

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery, poultry, vegetable selling, rice selling, etc.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her variety shop which will also include first aid kits, so as to earn more income to support the family and kids' education.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 45, is married and residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She has six children. 

For the last 22 years, she has been farming rice and growing cassava. The current business earns her about USD 21 per day and she can save about USD 15 each day after daily expenses.
 
Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Hammer & Nails is the nail shop for men. Established in the fall of 2013 by owner Michael, Hammer & Nails is the perfect salon for guys in the Los Angeles area to get the proper hand and foot care in the comfort of the ultimate man cave. 

Michael got the idea to open up Hammer & Nails when he realized that nail shops in the LA area only targeted women. As a result, he set out to create an environment that catered to men’s needs. Michael’s vision of the ultimate man cave led to large plasma TV’s showcasing all sports, kingsize leather chairs, and complimentary beverages, all while getting pampered.

“I knew pursuing Los Angeles’ first nail shop for guys was a huge risk…” Despite the challenges Michael has faced, his concept has caught people’s attention and more importantly their business.

Currently, Michael is asking for a $10,000 loan in order to pursue his dream of having a Hammer & Nail shop in cities all across the country. He plans to do this through franchising. By helping Michael, men across the country will have a place to call home the next time they visit a nail salon.

loans.use: To pay for franchise fees allowing Michael to pursue his dream of having a Hammer & Nail shop in cities all across the country

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 40-year-old married woman. Her financial conditions are very bad. Her son recently started to drive a moto-rickshaw which did not belong to him. He wants to get rid of paying daily fare/rental and desires to drive his own rickshaw. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body to make his own moto-rickshaw. 

He has a personal bike which he will convert into a moto-rickshaw so he can easily generate income for his siblings. A moto-rickshaw's body has a cheap cost but he does not have even a small amount of money. For the motivation of her son, Sajida requested a loan so he can buy the new rickshaw body and start driving.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body for her son to convert a bike into a moto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her pharmacy shop, where she sells drugs and treats people.

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, syringes and gloves. This will help Jackie to generate greater profits and increase her business's products and income. Jackie hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide for her family.

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drugs, syringes, and gloves

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hard-working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past seven years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her raw food business, where she sells matooke, Irish potatoes, and beans.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, matooke, and Irish potatoes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct a house out of the profits.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more beans, matooke, and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Sabohatkhon

texts.en:
Sabohatkhon is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1974. Sabohatkhon is married and has three children. She is a very careful mother. She has worked for more than 16 years in a local hospital as a cleaning woman. Sabohatkhon makes her work high quality. She is one of the best workers. 

She always wanted to provide her family with good living conditions but she lives poorly as her salary is small. She wants to buy furniture for her household but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy furniture for her household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Gurbangul

texts.en: Gurbangul is a kind woman from South Tajikistan. She is married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a builder. Gurbangul and her husband live together very happily. She has been busy selling children clothes. She loves children and tries to sell high-quality clothes for the children of her region. Gulbangul has own selling place in a local market. Thanks to the good service, she has her regular customers. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy children clothes to increase her working capital. Her profits will improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children clothes to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Нилуфар поставила себе цель стать известным учителем. С этой целью она поступила в Педагогический Университет Таджикистана. Нилуфар студентка 1 курса факультета Иностранных языков. Она учит английский и немецкие языки. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители  Нилуфара простые рабочие и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Нилуфар обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After finishing high school, Nilufar made a goal for herself, to become a famous teacher.  With this goal in mind, she entered the Tajik State Pedagogical University.  Nilufar is a freshman in the department of Foreign Languages, where she is studying English and German languages.  She is a very smart and a very hard-working young woman.  She is an A-student and she participates in all of the social events at her university.  Nilufar's parents are factory workers and they cannot afford to pay for the education of their child.  Nilufar turned to IMON International for a loan to pay for her tuition costs.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university education

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Lidia  de 48  años de edad, tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en casa propia vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de venta de ropa.
Doña Blanca Lidia también vende golosinas su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que ella visita en las fincas de camarón, cañera, fincas de melón y sandia, está solicitando el financiamiento para surtir el negocio porque en época navideña ella vende bastante.
Doña Blanca Lidia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva de hombre y de mujer como blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. tiene varios pedidos y desea aprovechar la ocasión para así de esa forma tener mejores ganancias. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera también mejorar sus ingresos, su sueño es tener un buen negocio de ropa en su casa y que las ventas se mejoren para este fin de año.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Lidia is 48 years old and has three dependent children.  She lives in her own home with her children and husband in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.  Blanca has been in the business of selling clothes for 10 years.  She also sells snack foods as a street vendor.  Her customers are friends, neighbors, and people who visit the shrimp, sugar cane, melon, and watermelon farms.  

Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business for the Christmas season, a time when her sales are adequate.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new clothing for men and women such as blouses, skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and other items.  She has several orders and wants to take advantage of this occasion so that she can earn more income.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her earnings.  

Blanca's dream is to have a successful clothing business in her home and to improve her sales at the end of the year.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, trousers, dresses, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is married and is a responsible father. He always makes sure that he can provide for all the needs of his family. Sandy has had a farming business for five years. He wakes up early in the morning to check his crops so that he can assure that his farming business is doing well. Sandy is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to plant on his farmland.

In the future, Sandy hopes that he could improve the growth of his crops so that he can improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором прекрасная женщина с медицинским образованием. Она родилась в 1964 года. Благодаря своим родителям она поступила в Медицинский институт и успешно окончила. Дилором более 24 года работает в местной больнице. Она очень любит свою профессию, однако она получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения ее 2 детей. Ее муж работает в заводе, и он тоже получает маленькую зарплату. Дилором и ее муж с трудом справляются с семейными расходами. Дилором должна купить печку и радиатор для утепления дома в зимний период, но не имеет денег. Она также хочет сделать частичный ремонт дома. С такой целью он обратилась за займом. Дилором запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки печки, радиатора и строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is a wonderful woman with a medical education.  She was born in 1964.  Thanks to her parents, she was able to successfully complete a program at the Medical Institute.  For more than 24 years, Dilorom has been working at the local hospital.  She loves her work very much, however, her small salary is not enough to provide for her two children.  Her husband works at a factory, and he too receives only a small income.  Dilorom and her husband are struggling with their household expenses.  

Dilorom needs to buy a stove and a radiator for heating the house during the winter, but she has no money to do so.  She also wants to start some home repairs.  With these goals in mind, she wishes to obtain a loan.  Dilorom is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to buy a stove, a radiator and building materials.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy stove, radiator and building materials to make home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and planks of wood and to pay workers.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng is 56 years old and married. Her husband produces some additional income for the family. They have been blessed with three children and she support two orphans. She has rental houses and she has been in business for 15 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 20,000.

She is borrowing KES 100,000 to purchase building materials to complete her rental houses. She plans to pay her children school fees with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is her first loan and her hopes and dreams are to expand and build more rental houses.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete her rental houses.

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Victorio is 47 years old and married. He lives in Isabela with his family. He has been a farmer for more than eight years. His business has really grown over the years. Now he seeks a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to buy  fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to grow on his farmland. He hopes that in the next five years he will be able to buy rental houses that will generate additional income for his business. 

The major challenge he has been facing on the farm is lack of insecticides. So, he hopes to obtain his requested loan amount to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to grow for his farming business

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. She lives in Bohol, Philippines. Minda has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 
Minda is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking seasonings. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock thus attracting more buyers.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn solely provides for her child's living. She has been running a transportation services business for more than three years, and she earns well for their needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her vehicle. 

Recently, she had borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a new set of tires to improve the services. She always want to improve their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 8 to 23. Vivencia has had a business making brick stoves for five years now. This is her main source of income. Her husband works in their farm. She is asking for a loan to buy steel, cement, and sand, which is needed for her stove production. 

In the future, Vivencia hopes of making her business a successful and sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy steel, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a well established farmer living in the highland area of Kericho. He is married and has four children and has been doing farming for the past 24 years. He produces a variety of things at his farm, but especially milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables, which he sells in the local market. In his many years of farming he enjoys dairy farming the most because milk is very vital to the growth of human beings, and this gives him more income. He finds dairy feeds to be a bit more expensive.

Titus chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund him because of their low interest rate and easy repayment mode. This loan will enable him to construct a dairy unit for his dairy cows, which will give them a conducive environment for growth. Through this loan, his family's income will increase and thus improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en:
Gulu, 23 years old, is from the village of Akaurta, Bolnisi district. He has a wife and two young children. He’s a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts on getting ahead. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Gulu was unable to get a higher education but he studied for a professional career and works as a driver. His monthly income is 300-400 GEL. He has also engaged in agricultural activities with a plot of farmland where he grows potatoes, maize and haricot. These products are used for trading and for his family's personal use.  
On his own initiative, Gulu wants to start his own business, sell a wide range of fruits and vegetables in the intercity. He would go through the streets in his own vehicle and sell products. Gulu is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support provided. He will be able to buy a greater amount and variety of produce so that his business will be well stocked. He will be able to take care of customers' needs, working and striving to reach his dream for financial stability and to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: To start a business trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Erica Vanesa

texts.es:
Ella es erica, tiene 19 años, convive con sus padres y los hermanos menores, uno de los hermanos esta esta en grado séptimo y la otra estudia en el instituto campo alto con ella, la hermana estudia auxiliar de salud oral y entra a segundo semestre y ella estudia cosmetologia y estética integral y entra a cursar tercer semestre.
Ella es una joven emprendedora, responsable, con sueño y meta por cumplir, uno de los sueños es poder terminar su técnico para poder salir adelante y tener una estabilidad económica, pero en estos momentos no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para pagar los estudios, ya que son dos personas de la misma familia a los que ay que pagarles, en este momento no cuentan con el dinero suficiente, a ella le gustaría que le colaboraran con el subsidio de kiva para ella poder terminar los estudios y hacer realidad el propio sueño de ser una esteticista profesional.
texts.en:
This is Erica who is 19 years old and lives with her parents and younger siblings. One of her brothers is in the 7th grade and a sister attends the Instituto Campo Alto with her. Erica's sister is studying to be a dental hygienist and is beginning her 2nd semester, while Erica is studying cosmetology, hoping to be a beautician, entering her 3rd semester.

Erica is an enterprising and responsible young woman with dreams and a goal to reach. One of her dreams is to be able to complete her technical training and to be able to get ahead and achieve economic stability. But in these moments, she lacks sufficient resources to pay for her studies, since there are 2 people in the same family with school bills to pay. At present, they lack sufficient money. She would like to have your collaboration in a Kiva subsidy so that Erica can complete her studies and make her dream of becoming a professional beautician a reality.

loans.use: to pay a semester of matriculation fees at beautician school.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares, hace cinco años estableció una tienda en su vivienda la cual atiende de todos los días.
Invertirá en la compra de cereales, azúcar, sal, arroz, jabón, golosinas, etc., con lo que su negocio estará surtido y  responderá a las necesidades de sus clientes en estas fechas en las que las ventas aumentan, espera tener una mejor economía, atraer a nuevos clientes, y cancelara responsablemente su crédito.
Sueña con adquirir un vehículo con el cual puede facilitar el traslado de mercadería.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and son in her own house. As she needed to generate an income to help with the household expenses, she set up a shop in her home five years ago and works there every day.

Ana will buy cereals, sugar, salt, rice, soap, sweets etc. so that her business will be well stocked and will meet her customers' needs during this period when her sales increase. She hopes to improve her financial situation, attract new customers and pay off her loan responsibly. 

Ana's dream is to buy a vehicle which would make it easier to transport her goods.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar, salt, rice, soap, sweets etc.

loans.name: Debulah

texts.en:
Debulah is a hard-working woman. Debulah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no child. For the past four years, Debulah has been working hard to manage her business selling raw produce, which includes matooke, potatoes, Irish potatoes, and watermelon.

To help expand her business, Debulah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits, matooke, potatoes, and Irish potatoes. This will help Debulah to generate greater profits and increase her business products. Debulah hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a landlord of houses.

Debulah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell, including fruits, matooke, potatoes, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Columba

texts.en: Columba is farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been farming for several years now. This is the source of her income. Columba is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is running a general store while her husband is working in a private company to make a living. She has been selling groceries for more than 13 years and has earned well from it for the family. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy more grocery items for sale. She is hopeful to sustain her business and to be able to have a stable source of income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
