texts.ru: Хусейн порядочный человек. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Он живет вместе со своей семьей на северной части Таджикистана. Хусейн 7 лет назад начал свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день он продает индустриальные товары, как ведро, корыто, швабра и т.п. Он торгует в магазине. Его магазин находится в центре города. Хусейн сам справляется с бизнесом. Он регулярно обновляет свой товар и таким образом привлекает больше клиентов. Хусейн хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал и с такой целью он обратился за займом. Хусейн запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки индустриальных товаров для расширения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Huseyn is a 50-year-old man who is decent and married with four children. He lives with his family in the northern part of Tadjikistan. 

Seven years ago, Huseyn started a business buying and selling food products. Now he sells household goods like pails, washtubs, mops, etc. in his store which he runs himself. The store is in the center of town. He regularly refreshes his inventory and thus attracts a lot of customers. 

Huseyn is looking to increase his working capital, and is thus requesting a loan of US$1,500 to purchase household goods. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home goods for resale.

loans.name: Clara Yudy

texts.es:
Clara es madre soltera que se ha ganado la vida a pulso, trabajando arduamente para sacar a su hijo adelante. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada pero, con el ánimo de mejorar su situación económica decidió tomar en arrendamiento un local con todos los activos necesarios para montar su propia tienda de abarrotes; el oficio lo aprendió mientras vivió con sus abuelos, quienes eran propietarios de un negocio similar.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito con el ánimo de comprar surtido al por mayor (granos, galletería, café, chocolate, productos de aseo, lácteos, carnes frías, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar buenos resultados para velar por el bienestar y el sustento de su hijo.
Esto le permitirá a Clara avanzar para cumplir el sueño de acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y que se convierta en su principal fuente de ingresos para garantizar a su hijo el acceso a una buena educación y brindarle mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clara is a single mom, who has earned her life working hard in order to raise her son well. Currently she is unemployed, but since she wants to improve her economic situation, she decided to rent a place with all the necessary assets to start her own general store. She learned this business while living with her grandparents, who owned a similar business.
She is asking for a loan to support her in buying stock at wholesale prices (grains, cookies, coffee, chocolate, cleaning products, dairy products, cold meats, sodas, among others), so she can start her productive project with which she hopes to produce good results for the welfare and living expenses of her son. This will allow Clara to fulfill her dream of strengthening her business so it becomes her main source of income to guarantee her son's access to a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy stock at wholesale prices (grains, cookies, coffee, chocolate, cleaning products, dairy products, cold meats, sodas, among others)

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 22-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and father in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. George gets orders and repairs houses. This is the only source of income for his family. As the income is not stable or enough to cover everyday costs, George decided to start his own business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3000 to start a business. With the received credit, he will purchase the raw materials to prepare Doner to sell. He has a commercial party, where he will start his Doner-making business. 

Doner is very popular fast-food, and George hopes that his business will be profitable and he will be able to generate a stable income. George awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up Doner (very popular fast-food) selling.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of two children, and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently.

She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, stout and beer for her business

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been dealing in the business of selling fabrics in her community for many years. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Rubina is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Rubina expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en: Magamed is a 42-year-old man from the village of Karajalari. He lives with his wife and two little children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow greens, but they earn insignificant income from selling them. It's hardly enough to pay all family costs and satisfy the needs of a four-member family.  Magamed is motivated to improve the living conditions of his family and increase agricultural activity. He requested a loan 3,000 GEL to purchase chickens and, after raising them, start selling their eggs. He received the credit through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a start-up program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start a business. Magamed and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 46, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a business making and selling bakery items, such as rusks, bread and biscuits, with the support of her son and husband. 

They have been doing this for many years and earn a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Naseem has become famous for providing a good-taste bakery. 

Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase stock of ingredients like flour, sugar, and salt, along with packs of oil.  

Naseem is hopeful that she will able to generate more income though her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase stock of ingredients like flour, sugar and salt, along with packs of oil.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood, age 54, has been successfully running a business selling milk to the people of her community for many years. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband is employed in a mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase a cow. It will help her increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 45, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.  She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another calf. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 30-years-old and a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Azra has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transportation service to his passengers. Azra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 51-year-old married woman. She is been in the business of running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her loan of PKR 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. 

She hopes to cater to more customers time after time and to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Fardoos

texts.en: Fardoos is a 41-year-old, vigorous lady and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling cloths for the last ten years to contribute to the family income. Fardoos buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Fardoos is requesting a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Fardoos expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 23-year-old lady of Petkathi village in Maynaguri. She has married Shyamal, a businessman. They have two children; one goes to school, and the other is too small to admit in a school. Shikha and her husband completed their education up to class VI (grade 6) and class IV (grade 4) respectively.

Shikha spends her most of the time doing household work, and her husband is associated with wood work. He sells firewood to people who use firewood for cooking. 

They need some capital to buy more firewood, as their customers are increasing day by day. Shikha applied for a loan of INR 15,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more stock of firewood. Nowadays there is a great demand for firewood in rural areas, as the price of LPG gas is going high, and the majority of rural houses use firewood for their cooking. 

Shikha thanks BJS and Kiva for giving this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for selling in the market.

loans.name: Faiqa

texts.en:
Faiqa is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 41-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory, and she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

She has two children; her husband is a driver by profession, but his income is insufficient to meet their household expenses alone. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes, and education.  

In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles, and thread in different colors. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000.  It will help in generating more income. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Milagro De Guadalupe

texts.es:
Milagro, es una mujer que a pesar de ser una madre soltera no se ha dejado vencer por la adversidad y ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, para cubrir los gastos familiares ella se dedica a vender variedad de antojitos y tamales lo hace de lunes a sábado, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio.
El préstamo le servirá para invertir en la compra de  harina, maíz, verduras, carnes, aceite, etc., que son parte de su materia prima para elaborar los antojitos y tamales. Espera aumentar producción, mejorar su calidad, mejorar las ventas, y mejorar su economía para cancelar las deudas y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
Sueña con mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y así contar con los recursos económicos para dar a sus hijos una oportunidad de superación educativa.
texts.en:
Despite being a single mother, Milagro is a woman who has not let herself be defeated by adversity and has taken good care of her three children. To cover the household expenses, she works selling a variety of popular snacks and tamales. She does this work from Monday to Saturday. So far, she has had no trouble running this business.

This loan will enable her to invest in the purchase of flour, corn, vegetables, meats, oil, etc., which are some of the raw materials required to make her snacks and tamales. She hopes to increase production, improve quality, sell more, and improve her budget in order to pay off debts and improve her family's living conditions.

Milagro dreams of improving her the profitability of her business in order to have the economic resources to give her children the opportunity to better themselves through education.

loans.use: to purchase flour, corn, vegetables, meats, oil, etc.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es: Vidalia es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos. Originaria de la ciudad Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de tortillería y pan casero. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, con los ingresos obtenidos de su trabajo anterior. Viajo a Costa Rica, con el fin de trabajar, regresa a Nicaragua con el objetivo de tener su propio negocio. Actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio prospero, el cual le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Su meta próxima es dar a conocer sus productos en los barrios de la ciudad. Solicita el crédito para comprar: azúcar, harina, manteca, huevos, polvo para hornear, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de su clientela. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y obtener un negocio creciente. Su plan futuro es tener su panadería.
texts.en:
Vidalia, 41, is married and has five children. She was born in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. She owns a tortilla and bread shop, which she started a few years ago with savings from previous work. She went to Costa Rica to work and came back to Nicaragua to start her own business. Her small business is profitable and generates income for her household. Her next goal is to make her products known in city neighborhoods.

She has applied for a loan to buy sugar, flour, shortening, eggs, baking powder, and more to meet customer demand. She believes the loan will help her fill customer orders and grow her business. She plans to one day have a bakery.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, shortening, eggs, baking powder, and more.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a member of VEP for the last three years. She belongs to one of the groups called Mutuma from central Kenya.  As a member, she was among the first women to benefit from a credit to buy a solar package and jikos for her home. The solar package enables her to charge mobile phones and to use a small radio as well as to save on buying kerosene. The jikos (economical cooking stoves) save at least 50 percent of the firewood and the charcoal consumption compared to what she was using before, therefore easing the burden of buying charcoal and collecting firewood daily. The cook stove also reduces smoke emissions, making it better for her health.
Seeing an opportunity, Elizabeth decided to be an entrepreneur by being a distributor for solars and jikos. She approached VEP for financing and received a credit facility that enabled her to purchase small solar systems and jikos to sell to other women in women groups. As she was repaying the loan she also invested some of the profits to grow her business. After clearing the first loan she has approached VEP again for a second loan to boost the stock and she hopes to reap even more profits by targeting larger groups for more sales.
With this credit Elizabeth will be financially stable enough to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase solars and jikos (cooking stoves) for sale

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Mario de 42 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 16 años, es originario de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven ha tenido que luchar para salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de postres y manjares, el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, todos los días recorre las calles ofreciendo a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima para los postres como leche, pan, canela, rin, servilletas, azucar, vasos descartables.  Mario agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mario, 42, is married and has a 16-year-old son. He was born in central Nicaragua, works hard, is responsible, and wants to succeed. He unfortunately didn't have money to study for a career. With effort and the desire to get ahead, he sells desserts and appetizers as a street vendor. He has had this business for 10 years, and he goes through the neighborhood every day selling to regular and new customers.

He will use this loan to buy supplies such as milk, bread, cinnamon, sugar, plastic cups, and napkins. Mario thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk, bread, cinnamon, sugar to make desserts and appetizers and to buy plastic cups and napkins.

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a 50-year-old local chicken trader in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of four children, and his spouse earns additional income for the family. He has been in his business for the last 21 years and has done great.

This marks Mgandi’s fifth loan from Vision fund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase more local poultry for his poultry business. He hopes to rear various local chicken breeds to feed the market around him and become a known local poultry trader in his community.

loans.use: To buy additional local chicken for his poultry business.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is a 38 years old mechanic whose garage repairs motor vehicles and motorcycles. He is a married father of six children. He has been in this business for the last twenty years and has done well.

This marks his fifth borrowing from Vision Fund, Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for motor vehicles and motorcycles for his garage. 

The anticipated profit will be used to expand further as well as service his loan. He hopes to have a modern garage in future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motor vehicles and motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchased used clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Sahnaz

texts.en:
Sahnaz is a 39 year-old married woman who has  been doing business selling milk for the past 10 years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. 

She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a motivated mother, and provides her family with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. 

Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 25-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 44 years old, a married woman and the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional form. 

For this reason, Shameem has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. 

This will help him drive more smoothly, and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Shameem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, and bowls. Her husband also assists her by selling the crockery to people in their community and in the local market. She earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a strong credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses, in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 57-year-old married woman running a business selling milk with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have five buffaloes and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells the milk to different places on a daily basis. They are happily working together to support their family. They also sell animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. They have three children and need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to increase profits, Shamim requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. They hope to increase the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more water and coal for her business.

loans.name: Manibala

texts.en:
Manibala is a 46-year-old woman of Maynaguri who is married to Gobinda. Both of them are illiterate, but can sign their names only. Her husband is a mason, and Manibala supplies materials, such as bricks, cement, stones, etc. for building construction, to the retail shops in the market. 

Manibala wants to develop her business to generate more income to maintain the family’s expenses, which are growing day by day.

Manibala requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more sand and stones to expand their business. She believes that through endurance and diligence, she can improve her business.

In the future, she wants to open a large builders’ shop in the local market with the profits of her business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and stones to expand her existing business of supplying building materials.

loans.name: Niorobala

texts.en:
Niorobala is a 47-year-old married woman, and her husband, Pulin, is 54 years old. Their only son is in class VI (grade 6). She has received education up to class IV (grade 4). They live in Khagrabari village of Maynaguri.

In childhood, Nirobala took the training of incense-making. Using that skill, she is preparing incense and supporting her family. Her husband is a mason. His income is not sufficient for the family. Sometimes he doesn’t have any work, especially in the rainy season. For the time being, he has to sit idle, and no income is generated by him at that time, so Nirobala wants to help her husband for a good livelihood. 

She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy raw materials like sticks, perfume, etc. for making incense on a large scale to sell in the market. She is trying to make her family’s financial condition better by contributing to her family the whole profit achieved from her own incense business.

Nirobala thanks BJS and Kiva for funding the loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (sticks, perfume, etc.) for incense-making.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор родилась в 1984 году. Она после окончания средней школы вышла замуж и родила двоих детей. Таким образом, она не смогла сразу после окончания средней школы поступить в университет и получить специальность. Гулрухсор 3 года назад поступила в Медицинский колледж. Она учится успешно. После окончания колледжа она будет работать в медицинское учреждение медсестрой. Гулрухсор должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет средства. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 400 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulruhsor was born in 1984.  After she finished high school, she got married and gave birth to two children.  Owing to this life event, she was not able to attend the university immediately after finishing high school to obtain an advance degree.  Three years ago, Gulruhsor was admitted into the Medical College where she became a successful student.  After completing college, she intends to work at a healthcare institution as a nurse.  Gulruhsor needs to pay for her tuition costs, but she does not have the financial means to do so.  She is asking for a loan of $400 dollars (USD) to pay for her college education.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her college education

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано прекрасная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 51 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Рано живет одна и сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Рано более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она производит дома «самбуса» и пельмени. Рано имеет своих клиентов. Ее клиенты из ее дома покупают ее пельмени и самбусы. Рано старается изготавливать свои продукции вкусно и качественно. Она считает, что только качественный  товар может привлечь много и постоянных клиентов. Рано живет в квартире, которое имеет плохое состояние. Рано планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру. Рано должна покрасить стена и починить сан.узел. Она должна завершить ремонт до праздника Нового года, так как ее друзья обещали у нее отмечать праздник. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта квартиры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rano is a wonderful and hardworking woman. She is 51 years old and divorced with no children. Rano lives alone and supports herself. 

She has had her own business for more than five years making and selling "sambusa" and pelmeni (dumplings). Rano has clients from her building who buy her food. She tries to make fresh and high-quality food, because she believes that only with a quality product can she attract and keep her customers. 

Rano lives in an apartment which is in poor condition. She plans to renovate it by painting the walls and fixing the bathroom. She should finish the renovation before the New Year's because her friends are coming to spend the holiday with her. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy building materials to fix her apartment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.ru: Лобар родилась в 1990 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Лобар умная женщина. Она окончила Педагогический колледж. Данное время она работает в средней школе. Лобар хочет получить высшее образование и развеваться карьерной лестнице. С такой целью она поступила в Педагогический Университет. Лобар учится в заочное отделение. Она справляется и с семьей и с работой и с учебой. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Лобар должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lobar was born in 1990.  She is married and is raising three children.  Lobar is a smart young woman, who completed the Pedagogical College.  Currently, she is working in a high school.  Lobar wishes to obtain a university-level education and to advance further in her current career.  Driven by this goal, she enrolled into the Pedagogical University to take night classes.  She is a very hard-working woman and she is managing taking care of her family, a job and school, all at the same time.  Lobar needs to pay her tuition costs, but she does not have the money to do so.  She is asking for a loan of $350 dollars (USD) to pay for her university education.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university education

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a young agronomist from Haytagh village, in the Ararat region. He lives with his wife. 

To take care of their needs, both of them are engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of potato, cabbage, eggplant, and greens. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Arman needs a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane and bottles), to purchase fertilizer, and to buy potato seeds. 

Arman had taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, he wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during recent times, Arman was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Arman and his wife will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane and bottles), to purchase fertilizer, and to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late 40s, is married and the mother of two children who are still at school.  She has been a tailor since 1993 and works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily to make a small monthly profit.

She is requesting her tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy materials, two sewing machines and other equipment. She has paid back all her loans successfully and used the profit to buy a plot of land, pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy materials and sewing equipment.  Her dream is to build her own house.

Mary will share this loan with her group Jitahidi Msakuzi, which has 11 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and sewing equipment.

loans.name: Prossy Rose

texts.en:
Prossy Rose is a hard-working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa, in the region of Iganga, in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Prossy has been working hard to manage her tomato business, in which she sells tomatoes. 

To help expand her business, Prossy Rose has requested a loan of UGX 150,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes and it will help Prossy Rose to generate greater profits that can be diverted to another business. Prossy Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up a hotel. 

Prossy Rose is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a 26-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. She is a married mother of one child whose husband supports the family with additional income. She has been in this business for the last three years and is doing great.

This marks Karen’s second loan from Vision Fund to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, bags of maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat for her retail shop. She will use the anticipated profit to open a new business. She hopes to be a successful business lady in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bags of maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Este es el  grupo “Prosperidad Y Amistad” constituida por 05 socios responsables y activos. Irma de 55 años es casada con 05 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Hace más de 10 años que Irma se dedica al alquiler de combis. Este negocio comenzó gracias a la motivación de su pareja, pues  es él quien la ayuda. Actualmente cuenta con 04 combis. Se siente feliz, pues puede seguir apoyando a su familia. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará  para el  mantenimiento de  sus combis. El deseo de Irma es de comprar otra combi. El grupo “Prosperidad Y Amistad” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Irma es la primera del lado derecho,  viste polo verde y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
This is the "Prosperithy and Friendship" Group, made up of 5 responsible and active members. 

Irma is 55 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is still her dependent. For the last 10 years Irma has dedicated her efforts to renting minibuses. She began the business motivated by her husband who has helped her. Irma has 4 minibuses at present and is content, since she is able to continue helping her family.

The loan she requests is for maintaining the minibuses. She also wishes to buy an additional minibus.

The "Prosperity and Friendship" Group is grateful to Kiva investors for their offer of aid. Irma is the 1st on the right, wearing a dark green polo shirt and sky-blue pants.

loans.use: to maintain her minibuses.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who has  been working in a knitting business for nine years to support her husband in making their living and covering almost all of their family's needs.

Khadija is a hard worker who puts so much effort into addressing her family's and customers' needs. In addition to knitting, she has special embroidery talents that she sells to customers upon request. Khadija is the only person who provides such services in her region, which makes her business unique and highly requested. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school bus fees to make sure that they will have safe transportation, since neither she or her husband can provide their children with this service because of their business commitments.

She is working hard to open her own handmade business where she can recruit several ladies to help her in addressing the increasing customer requests.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school bus fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dental Bobar Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DENTAL BOBAR est un GIE composé de 5 personnes qui habitent ensemble. Leur principal souhait c’est le développement de leur quartier ainsi ils pensent que seul le travail peut satisfaire ce besoin. Le Président s’appelle Djariétou, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle fait du commerce de la crème glace, de l’eau fraiche et des jus. Elle est mariée et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter du sucre et tous ce qui va dans la préparation de ses glaces et jus. Elle commence sa journée  à 8h pour la finir à 18h.A l’avenir elle souhaite diversifier son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
The Dental Bobar Group is an Economic Interest Group (GIE), made up of five people who live together.  Their principal desire is to see their neighbourhood develop, and they believe that the only way to achieve this is to work hard.  

The president is Djariétou, seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She sells ice cream, fresh water and juices.  Djariétou is married and helps her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their family.  She has more than five years' experience in her business.  

Djariétou will use her loan to buy sugar and all the other ingredients needed to prepare her ice creams and juices.  She starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 6pm.

In the future, Djariétou would like to diversify her business in order to increase her earnings, and be able to save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk to make ice cream and juices for resale.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим 19 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына, которому 2 года. У Мээрим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мээрим занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мээрим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь и 4 тонны картофеля. Мээрим арендует земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет. Картофель продаст в этом месяце, то есть в январе- оптом по 18 сом (KGS), что даст хороший доход. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээрим обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку собственного жилья, так как на сегодняшний день Мээрим с семьей проживает с в родительском доме мужа вместе с родителями мужа.
texts.en: Meerim is 19 years old, married and raising one son, who is 2 years old, together with her husband. Meerim has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 2 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Meerim's hard work, today her business contains 1 horse and 4 tons of potatoes.  Meerim leases a 1.0 hectare plot of land, where she plants potatoes, wheat, barley and sainfoin.  She will sell potatoes this month (January) wholesale at 18 som (KGS), which will bring in a good income.  The monthly aggregate income amounts to 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Meerim requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a high price.  Meerim plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing domestic livestock quantities and plans to to save money to buy her own home because today she and her family live in her husband's parents' home together with the husband's parents.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 26 years old.  He is married and has one child.  

He has spent five years working in the business of farming.  He would like to use a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to use during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production.  With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity in the future. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use during maize production.

loans.name: Asila

texts.ru: Асила молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Она вдова и одна воспитывает своего ребенка, которому 3 года. Асила после смерти мужа переехала жить к своим родителям. Она начала свой бизнес скотоводством, чтобы помочь своим родителям по обеспечение семьи. Асила более 3 лет занимается скотоводством. Она откармливает скот несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Также Асила продает молоко местным жителям. Асила находится в трудном положении. Ее брат сильно болен и ему срочно необходимо лечится, однако семья Асилы не имеет денег для лечения. Асила запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения брата. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Asila is a young and a goal-oriented woman.  She is a widow and is raising a three-year-old child.  After the death of her husband, Asila move in with her parents and started her own business of cattle raising in order to help her parents with the household necessities.  Asila has been raising cattle for more than three years now.  She fattens her cattle for a few months and then sells it at the local market.  She also sells the milk to the local residents.  Asila is in a difficult situation at the moment, her brother is critically ill and is in need of treatment.  However, Asila's family does not have the necessary financial means to pay for the medicine.  Asila is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to purchase the required medicine for her brother.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine that is needed to treat her ill brother

loans.name: Kaay Bakh Group

texts.fr: Le groupement KAAY BAKH est composé de 4membres qui habitent dans la même maison et ont une seule ambition qui est de travailler. Leur présidente s’appelle Amsatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans le commerce. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des tissus pour la confection et collection de boubou qu’elle revend à ses clients potentiels. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir, elle souhaite  avoir des machines à coudre pour mieux exploiter son activité et augmenter ses revenus de ce fait elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Kaay Bakh Group is made up of four members who all live in the same house and share the same ambition, which is to work.  Their president is Amsatou.  She is married, with children and works in commerce.  She has more than five years' experience in her business.  

Amsatou has requested this loan in order to buy fabric to make boubous (traditional Senegalese clothing), for sale to her customers.  She starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 6pm.  Amsatou helps her husband with the daily expenses of their household and the school charges of their children.

In the future, Amsatou would like to have sewing machines to improve the efficiency of her business and, therefore, her earnings.  In this way, she would be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to make boubous (traditional Senegalese clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Isiea

texts.en:
Isiea is 30; he is married with two children. 

He has requested a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer to increase production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to use during maize production.

loans.name: Kholmahmad

texts.ru: Холмахмад трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в 1956 года. Холмахмад женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Он начал свой бизнес 2 года назад купле продажей дисков. Он имеет свою лавочку на местном рынке. Холмахмад поставил аппарат для поп-корма возле своей лавки и продает поп-корм. Он этим получает дополнительный доход, так как для обеспечения большой семьи требуется больше денег. Холмахмад должен купить новый аппарат для производства поп-корма, так как его аппарат недавно сломался. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки аппарата для поп-корма. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ему развевать бизнес.
texts.en: Kholmahmad is a hard working man.  He was born in 1956.  Kholmahmad is married and is raising four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He started his business of selling CDs and DVDs two years ago.  He has his own stall at the local market.  Kholmahmad placed a popcorn making machine next to his stall and sells popcorn to the shoppers.  With this, he is able to provide for his large family.  Kholmahmad needs to purchase a new popcorn machine because the old one recently broke.  He is asking for a loan for 10000 comoni to purchase a new popcorn machine.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.  This loan will help Kholmahmad to advance his business.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 26-year-old, married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Robina’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Robina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es: John, a sus 41 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo. Desde que era niño ha sentido un gusto especial por las artesanías y las manualidades, se dedicaba a recoger objetos que las personas desechaban y los convertía en un artículo útil y decorativo y, luego los vendía a sus familiares y conocidos. Con el paso del tiempo tuvo que hacerse responsable de su familia, pues tuvo su primer hijo muy joven, por lo que se dedicó a buscar empleo para generar recursos económicos fijos que le permitieran sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Esto lo obligó a dedicarle sólo los tiempos libres, a su labor como artesano; sin embargo no pierde el interés en la actividad, pues manifiesta que es mejor convertir algunos desechos en arte y no contaminar más la tierra, además esto le genera un ingreso adicional para su familia. Por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará un taladro industrial, una prensadora manual, una máquina dobladora pequeña, un soldador y comprar algunos artículos en una chatarrería; con lo que podrá optimizar el tiempo de producción y mejorar sus productos, especialmente para la temporada de diciembre, pues en esta época aumenta su demanda. John sueña con hacer de esta actividad su principal fuente de ingresos, formalizar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo dentro de su núcleo familiar y así ser totalmente independiente y mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de los que ama.
texts.en:
John, 41, is married and has three children, for whom he works hard to support. Since childhood, he has has an affinity for making handicrafts. He collected things that others had thrown away and made them into useful, decorative objects to sell to family and acquaintances. With time, he became responsible for supporting his family, as he had a son at a young age. So he looked for a job that would provide steady income to pay for his family's needs. This meant that he could only work as an artist in his spare time; however, he never lost interest in the profession. He says that it is better to make art from discarded materials and not contaminate the environment; moreover, he can earn additional income for his family by doing this. 

He has applied for a loan to buy an industrial drill, a hand press, a small bending machine, a welding machine, and some items from a scrap yard. He will be able to make better use of his time and improve his merchandise, specifically for the December holiday season when demand picks up. John dreams of making this work his main source of income, setting up the business, and being able to offer jobs to family members so that he can be totally independent and slowly raise the standard of living of those he loves.

loans.use: to buy an industrial drill, a hand press, a small bending machine, a welding machine, and some items from a scrap yard.

loans.name: Manzuura

texts.ru: Манзууре 21 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына, которого она родила в этом году. Манзуура сразу же после окончания школы вышла замуж за Рамила, в связи с этим не смогла окончить какое-либо высшее учебное заведение. У Манзууры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Манзуура занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Манзууры , в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 20 овец. Параллельно Манзуура  занимается полеводством, имеется 1,80 ГА собственной долевой земли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. По хозяйству помогают супруг Манзууры и ее свекровь, которая проживает вместе с ними.Во избежание падежа и болезни скота Манзуура проводит ветеринарные мероприятия два раз в год. Скот Манзуура содержит дома, так как дома имеются все условия по содержанию скота. Лишь в сезонное время скот будет отогнан на пастбища. У Манзууры имеются доходы от реализации молока, а также от полеводства. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Манзуура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Манзуура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Manzuura is 21 years old, and married. She and her husband have one son who was born this year. Manzuura married Ramil right after finishing school, so she wasn't able to get a higher education. 

Manzuura has a high school education and now farms and raises livestock to provide the family's main income. She started four years ago by buying cattle for 5,000 KGS. Due to her hard work, she now has two dairy cows, two calves and 20 sheep. At the same time, Manzuura farms 1.8 hectares on which she grows beans and clover. Her husband helps her, along with her mother-in-law who lives with them. 

To care for her animals, Manzuura hires a veterinarian twice a year. She has her cattle at home where she has the needed set-up for them. Only in season does she take them to the cattle pasture. She gets income from milk sales and from farming. Her monthly income is 11,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Manzuura would like to take a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy a heifer for cattle breeding. She plans to use the profits to invest in further increasing her herd and save to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: William  Alberto

texts.es: William tiene 38 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Casado y padre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares.  Negocio que inicio hace pocos años, vendiendo frutas con su pareja. Luego con las ganancias obtenidas se independizo. Hoy en día es dueño de su propio negocio, el cual le ha sido de ayuda para los gastos e ingresos para su hogar. Su meta próxima es poner una sucursal y ampliar la mercadería de su local. Solicita el crédito para comprar: auriculares, protectores para celulares, baterías, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su mercadería y aumentar su negocio. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo su negocio cada vez más.
texts.en: William is 38 years old and comes from the town of Estelí. He's married and has two children. He's a vendor by trade and he sells cell phone accessories. He started in the business a few years ago by selling fruit alongside his partner. Soon, with the profits he made he became independent. Nowadays he owns his own business, which has helped him with his expenses and yields profits for his household. His next goal is to open a second store and diversify the merchandise in his store. He requests the loan in order to purchase earphones, cell phone cases, batteries, etc., so that he can offer his customers more variety. He believes that he loan will be of great help, since he'll be able to stock up on merchandise and increase his turnover. His plan for the future is to keep on further expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase earphones, cell phone cases, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Kadrije

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Kadrije has made a living by selling dairy products including raw milk, cottage cheese and butter in a farmers’ market in a nearby town. She wants to expand her business by buying some baby goats, and is requesting this loan for 100,000 Albanian Lek to make that possible. She has been a long-time client of VFA.

Kadrije is married and the mother of two children who are 20 and 13 years old and still attend school. Unfortunately, one of her children was born with certain disabilities. They live in the rural south-central part of the country where the terrain is very rough and roads are bumpy; this has made it hard for the villagers to visit nearby towns as often as needed. Roads are still in the same condition today, but this family has no choice but to travel into town to sell its products.

loans.use: to buy baby goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, oil, and rice to sell

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab, 53 years old, is from the village of Didi Chkoni in the Martvili district. He has a wife, son and daughter-in-law. His son works on the bus line and generates 350 GEL monthly. Merab's wife is a saleslady and earns 300 GEL monthly. Merab runs an agricultural business harvesting nuts and kiwi. The products are sold locally and he gets a small income from this activity. Now Merab wants to start another activity that will increase the family's income and be more stable. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of $4,000 for purchasing a secondhand car. Merab will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them intercity. He is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his family has a good life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Merab is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline lives in the outskirts of Lyantonde town where she does farming and sells the surplus to earn an income to meet the needs of her children. This being a harvest season, Pauline wants a loan so that she will be able to buy surplus produce at a low cost from farmers and sell later when the prices have increased. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy surplus produce to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Papuna

texts.en:
Papuna is a 24-year-old man, from Kutaisi city. His only family member is his grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. 

Papuna is unemployed at this moment, in spite of having high education. He has great desire to seek a fortune in private business. He decided to start his fast food business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times since Papuna didn't satisfy their requirements. 

Papuna received credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo called the Start-up Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of USD 1,200, Papuna will purchase inventories, such as a display, refrigerator, machine tools, and furniture for his business. This will give him a chance to earn his own income and not depend on others. He dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for his little family.

loans.use: to open a fast food business.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en: Yosam is a 65-year-old married man who is having a difficult time paying his children's tuition. This is an urgent problem for him because his children are about to begin their school year and he has been unable to take care of all the things they need. He thanks Ugafode for helping him request a loan which will resolve this dilemma. He is an honest man.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 54 years old, married, and earns a living by raising and selling cattle. Because he has only limited amounts of capital, he is requesting a loan to increase his productivity by buying more cows that he will sell at a profit to support his family. He thanks UGAFODE for financing low-income earners like himself. He is a hard-working person who is committed to succeeding in life.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 34-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Biral,  in their own house in a small town of Maynaguri. Her husband makes foundations for houses. She has read up to class VIII (grade 8). They have two children. One goes to school, and the other is too small to go to school.

Her husband’s earning is very low, and it is difficult to maintain the family expenditures. Both of them decided to start a new business. Then Sumitra came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a rickshaw for carrying people and goods in their locality. A rickshaw is a type of carriage using a bicycle. 

Now her husband is pulling the rickshaw, and his earnings have increased from his previous earnings. Their future dream is to buy more rickshaws, which will be used on a hire basis, so that her family will have a stable income.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for carrying people and goods.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana is a 37-year-old hardworking lady from a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She stays with her husband and two children (sons).  One son is in class X (grade 10) and other is in class VIII (grade 8). Archana and her husband are illiterate, but know how to sigh their name. They have a small sweet shop where her husband sells different types of sweets. But he has a small income. The income from the business is not sufficient to meet the educational expenses of their sons and the household expenses. 

Biman, the younger son of Archana, is a meritorious student who stood first in his class. She seeks this loan to support her son’s education so that he does not face any difficulty in receiving his education. This loan would help her to pay the tuition fees, to purchase education equipment like books, notebooks, pens, pencil etc. and to pay private coaching fees for her son’s education. 

Archana and Biman (in the photo) are very thankful to BJS and Kiva for this educational loan.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees, private coaching fees and other school expenses for her son.

loans.name: Chaya

texts.en:
Chaya lives in a small town in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a courageous housewife and blessed with one daughter. She lives with her husband in a small mud house. Her husband sells betel nuts (they are used as a mouth freshener) in the local bazaar. His income is so small that they cannot even afford the educational expenses of her daughter. Chaya and her husband decided to discontinue her daughter’s education. 

Suddenly, one fine day Chaya met with a Credit officer from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and came to know that BJS gives loans to poor women to educate their children. She decided to take a loan from BJS for her daughter’s education so that her daughter can continue her studies. With this loan, she will pay the school fees and buy school dresses and other necessary study materials like books, notebooks, pen, pencils, for her daughter’s schooling.

Now Chaya is very ambitious for her daughter and quite relaxed about her daughter’s education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her financially to secure her daughter’s future. Chaya and her daughter (shown in the photo) give hearty thanks to Kiva and BJS for this educational loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy school dresses and study materials for her daughter

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a hard working woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the  region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and will help generate greater profits and improve on her business. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to have more sacks of charcoal to boom her business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
Kadija is a hard working woman.  Kadija is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Iganga in Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  For the past two years, Kadija has been working hard to manage a retail shop, which sells sugar, beans and other items. 

To help expand her business, Kadija has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more sugar, beans and other needed items and it will help Kadija generate greater profits, which she will use to pay the rent for her parents’ house.  Kadija hopes that in the future she will be able to start a hotel. 

Kadija is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans and other items.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives in the Gegharkunik region in Sevan city. She lives with her parents and her school-aged brother. She is a student of Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute in the Department of Psychology and Sociology and she studies at the distance-learning division. This will be Arevik’s second loan. The first one she has taken in order to pay her tuition fee for the first semester and she is very thankful for that support. This time her loan has a very different theme: she is going to get married and she is going to have a lot of expenses connected with it.
She asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to organize her wedding party so that it is nice and chic.
Nor Horizon staff wishes her great happiness and good luck and we are sure that Kiva lenders will join our wishes also.

loans.use: to organize her wedding party so that it is nice and chic.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a hard-working woman.  Aisha is 22 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Iganga in Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  For the past two years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her business, which is to sell shoes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Aisha generate greater profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her child.  Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Recheal

texts.en:
Recheal is a hard-working woman.  Recheal is 24 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  For the past three years, Recheal has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar and beans. 

To help expand her business, Recheal has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more rice, sugar and other items and it will help Recheal generate greater profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her child.  Recheal hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Recheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Ya Salam Group

texts.fr: YA SALAM est un groupement composé de 5 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier et se réunissent a chaque foi de besoin.  Leur présidente s’appelle AWA, elle est mariée et mère de famille. On le reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées de 1er nécessité comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile, le savon, lait en poudre, petit déjeuner etc.………………Elle n’a aucunes charges a part ses besoins personnelles. Elle demande ce montant pour acheter ces produits et les revend à ses clients. Elle a une expérience de 4ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 19h. Elle voudra renforcer et diversifier son activité et grâce aux crédits de l’institution ouvrir une boutique pour gagner d’avantage de client et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Ya Salam is a group of five members who all live in the same neighbourhood and come together whenever they need to.  

Their president is Awa, seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She is married and has children. 

 Awa sells basic foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, milk powder, breakfast products, etc.  She is not financially responsible for anyone but herself.  Awa has requested this loan in order to buy these products for resale to her customers.  She has four years' experience in her business and works from 9am to 7pm.   Awa would like to strengthen and diversify her business.  

In the future, she would like to use loans from the field partner to open her own shop to attract more customers, and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and soap for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is aged 40. He is married with six children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase maize production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers during maize production.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 52 года, замужем, все дети все взрослые и самостоятельные. У Айнагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Супруг и дочь помогают по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец. Скот содержится дома, все условия для содержания скота имеются. Айнагул сама доит корова и реализовывает оптовым продавцам на ежедневной основе, что тоже приносит небольшие доходы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади, лошадь нужна для того чтобы пасти скот на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение материального состояния своей семьи.
texts.en: Ainagul is 52 years old, married, and has fully grown children, who are fully independent.  Ainagul has a high school education.  The main source of income for Ainagul's family is cattle raising, which she started 12 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 10,000 som (KGS).  Her spouse is helping her with running this business.  Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, she currently has two milk cows and 20 sheep.  Ainagul has all of the necessities to keep livestock in her house.  Ainagul milks the cows herself and sells the milk to daily, which provides some additional income.  Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to advance her business, Ainagul turned to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy a horse.  A horse will help with grazing of the cattle in the fields.  Profits from her business, Ainagul plans to reinvest to increase the headcount of her herd.  She is also planning to set some money aside with a purpose of improving the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Carmen tiene 52 años, vive en unión libre y se dedica al comercio desde hace 6 años. Un familiar la inicio en el comercio de la venta de artículos por catálogo como calzado, utensilios de cocinas y para el hogar; a ella le gustó mucho y le emocionó vender. 

Todos estos artículos se los vende a familiares y amigos que ya la ubican como vendedora de estas cosas. Pide este préstamo sobre todo por la época del año, en la cual habrá muchas ventas; en específico quiere comprar ropa, perfumes y calzado para ofrecer, tener más ventas e incrementar sus ingresos. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo Carmen ha logrado ayudar a sus familiares, sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacer mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story. She is 52 and lives in a common-law marriage. She has been working in selling for 6 years. A family members introduced her to the business of selling catalogue items such as shoes, kitchen utensils and household items, and she liked this very much and was thrilled with selling. She sells all these items to family members and friends, who now recognise her as a seller of such things.

Carmen is asking for this loan at this particular time of year when there will be a lot of sales. Above all, she wants to buy clothes, perfume and shoes to offer, to increase her sales and to augment her income. Thanks to her efforts in this work, Carmen has managed to help her family members, allow her children to get ahead and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and shoes to sell at this time of year.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from Haykashen village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband. To take care of their needs both of them are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They cultivate greens in greenhouses and alfalfa. Aida and her husband sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. 

As their needs are increasing with time Aida wants to expand her agribusiness to be able to more effectively cover her family’s needs. She wants to build new greenhouses. To reach her goal she is requesting a loan for $2,000, which she will use to purchase necessary materials such ascellophane, bottles, and pipes for greenhouse construction. 

As this is Aida’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials such as cellophane, bottles, and pipes for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Columba tiene 41 años y es madre soltera de una hija de 23 años, la cual ya no depende de ella. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 25 años, inició vendiendo antojitos mexicanos y actualmente tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

En su pequeña tienda que tiene dentro de su domicilio vende refrescos, dulces, galletas y frituras. Adicionalmente tiene otros dos negocios: vende artículos por catálogo como cosméticos y utensilios para el hogar, y le ayuda a fabricar piñatas a un vecino en su casa.
