Este préstamo lo pide para surtir mejor su tienda y así tener mayores ingresos. Con la dedicación puesta en su negocio Columba ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija, gozar de estabilidad económica y hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Columba is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

Columba, 41, is the single mother of a 23-year-old daughter, who no longer depends on her. For 25 years, Columba has run a business. At first, she sold Mexican appetizers and snacks, and now she has a small grocery shop in her house, where she sells beverages, candy, cookies, and fried foods. She also sells catalog merchandise like cosmetics and kitchen utensils, and she helps make pinatas at a neighbor's house.

She has applied for this loan to stock more inventory in her shop so that she can earn more money. With her dedication to the business, Columba has managed to support her daughter, enjoy financial stability, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Brenedinda

texts.es:
Brenedinda es una joven de 23 años de edad madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su esposo en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivado el café, maíz y frijol. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. Sus cultivos están ubicados a un kilómetro de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando para dar asistencia técnica evitando de esa manera daños en sus cosechas.
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.
Su sueños comprar la maquinaria necesaria para elaborar el proceso completo para vender el café como una despulpadora un motor de pilas y todo lo demás. También mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad, ser una de las caficultoras más fuertes para dedicarse a la compra-venta ya que sus hijos son la prioridad más grande, sus estudios y otras necesidades que diariamente se presentan para el mejoramiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Brenedinda is 23 years old and lives with her husband and their two young children. With her parents' dedication and support, Brenedinda was able to complete her elementary education, but she was not able to continue studying in high school, as she needed to work to help her parents make ends meet. From a very young age, Brenedinda helped her parents with their farming operations (coffee, corn and beans), leading to her extensive agricultural knowledge and experience. Currently, Brenedinda farms coffee and sells her coffee beans directly to large distributors in the area. Her coffee plants are located about a half mile from her home, and she frequently walks between her house and her crops to make sure they receive consistent attention.

With the support from this loan, Brenedinda plans to purchase agricultural input items for tending her coffee plants, including manure, fertilizers and other products. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her coffee crops and protect them from pests and disease. Her dream is to eventually purchase machinery that would allow her to complete the entire coffee production process, including removing the skin, drying and then roasting the beans. Brenedinda also hopes to purchase more coffee plants over time to increase the diversity and quality of her harvest, becoming one of the greatest coffee farmers in the region and supporting her children in their dreams along the way.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural input items for tending her coffee plants.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. In 2009, he started his own business which consists of selling vegetables. Today, Ibrahim wants to buy more vegetables with the aim of gaining superior income to be able to provide his family with better financial support. To do so, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Ibrahim is very eager to receive the funds as he is pretty sure that it will lend him a hand to reach his goals and meet his business requirements.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Abduqodir

texts.ru: Абдукодир работает в собственном пекарне. Он занимается производством национальных таджикских лепешек. Ему 27 лет. Абдукодир женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он проживает со своей семьей в районе А.Джоми. Жена Абдукодира работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Абдукодир занимается  выпечкой и продажей лепешек последние 5 лет. Сейчас он обратился за кредитом для развития деятельности. Он хочет купить муку и дров. В будущем за счет прибыли с продажи лепешек он планирует приобрести скот в свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Abduqodir owns his own bakery. He bakes traditional Tajik flat bread. He is 27 years old. Abduqodir is married and has one child. He lives with his family in A. Jomi. Abduqodir works on a communal farm . Abduqodir has been baking and selling flat bread for the last five years. Now he has applied for a loan to expand his business. He wants to buy flour and firewood. In the future, with profits he makes from selling his goods, he plans to buy livestock for his farm.

loans.use: buy flour and firewood to make flat bread.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Ему 51 года, женат и на воспитании имеет 6 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. Кроме скотоводства он занимается и пчеловодством. Он имеет 40 ящик пчел. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdurauf is in need of your support because lately, he has financial problems.  He is 51 years old, married and is raising six children.  The climate of his region is favorable to raising crops and raising cattle.  For more than 10 years, Abdurauf has been raising livestock.  He sells milk to his neighbors, who are very grateful for having access to naturally produced milk.  Also, he fattens cattle for a few months and then sells it.  Beside these activities, he also keeps bees, and at the moment, he has 40 bee houses.  He has many clients at the market.  He wishes to advance his business further, but has no financial means to do so.  He is asking for a loan of $1,700 dollars (USD) to purchase cattle in order to expand his enterprise.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en: Mimoza is back again.  She needs your help to buy inventory for her grocery store and with the rest buy fodder, corn and wheat for the animals.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for her grocery store and also buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells, rice, salt, matchboxes, bread, juice, and sweets. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock of rice, salt, and matchboxes and will help Josephine to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to sustain her and the children's well being. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, salt, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Jackline has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes for children and ladies. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay house rent for her and her siblings. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a tailoring school. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар холостой молодой человек в возрасте 20 лет. В настоящее время он является студентом и нигде не работает. Диловар учится в заочном отделении Государственного Университета города Кургантюбе на экономиста.  Диловар старший сын в семье. У него еще есть трое младших братьев и сестра. Он решил начать зарабатывать и совмещать учебу с работой. Диловар просит кредит, чтобы купить легковую автомашину и начать предоставлять услугу такси. Он будет работать по маршрутной линии город Кургантюбе-город Душанбе и в день делать по два рейса. Диловар хочет откладывать получаемую прибыль с новой деятельности и самому платить за учебу. У него большая семья и он хочет помочь родителям.
texts.en: Dilovar is an unmarried young man, 20 years old. Currently he is a student and is not employed. Dilovar studies economics through a distance education program at the State University of Qurgan-Tube. Dilovar is the eldest son in the family. He has three younger brothers and a sister. He decided to start earning a living, so he will both study and work. Dilovar is asking for a loan to buy a car and begin a taxi service. He will drive the route between Qurgan-Tube and Dushanbe twice a day. Dilovar wants to use his earnings to pay tuition. He has a big family, and he wants to help his parents.

loans.use: buy a car so he can work

loans.name: Karla Nohemy

texts.es:
Karla, decidió por otro crédito para invertir en el inventario de su chalet, comprara bebidas, yuca, pan y golosinas, con lo que contara con productos que sus clientes necesitan.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió variedad de productos que fortaleció su negocio, aumentos sus ventas, tiene más clientes satisfechos, ha cancelado sus deudas y sigue aportando en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Karla decided to get another loan to invest in merchandise for her shop. She will buy beverages, yucca, bread and snacks, so that she will have the products that her customers need. With the previous loan she got a variety of products that strengthened her store, increased her sales, and satisfied more customers. She has paid off her debts and continues helping with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy beverages, yucca, bread and snacks.

loans.name: Douglas Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Douglas Mauricio   de  33   años de edad , vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos  que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la fabricación de ventanas, puertas, muebles.
Don  Douglas Mauricio   vende también muebles para el hogar, sus clientes son los conocidos y amigos que lo buscan el tiene un buen taller en su casa, con dos operarios permanentes.
Don Douglas es un hombre emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra  de materia prima  como ser maderas y pinturas y aprovechar esta época navideña, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida es su tercer préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
Don Douglas su sueño es tener más clientes para su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Douglas Mauricio, 33, lives with his spouse and two dependent children in the community of San Lorenzo, in the southern valley of Honduras. He owns his home and for 5 years has worked manufacturing windows, doors and furniture. His customers are acquaintances and friends who seek him out. He has a good workshop in his home with two full-time workers.

Douglas is an entrepreneurial man with desires to get ahead, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy materials like wood and paint so that he can take advantage of the Christmas season. With the support of this loan he plans to improve his income and ultimately his quality of life. This is his third loan with Prisma. Douglas's dream is to have more customers for his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013.

loans.use: to buy wood and paint for his business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Silvia tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Desde hace años 3 años inició su negocio de antojitos mexicanos, antes de dedicarse esto hacía ventas por catálogo de cosméticos y utensilios para el hogar. 

En su puesto Silvia vende pozole, café de olla, ponche, quesadillas, pambazos, tostadas, tacos de bistek, de longaniza, carne enchilada y chuleta, sopes y gorditas. Pide este préstamo para hacer mejores en su negocio y tenerlo más presentable.

Gracias al tiempo que tiene con su negocio Silvia ha logrado comprar electrodomésticos, utensilios de cocina, una parrilla, tener su negocio, pagar deudas y contribuir a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Silvia is a customer with Kubo Financing and this is her story: she is 42 years old, married and has two children. Three years ago she started her business selling Mexican snacks; prior to that she had sold cosmetics and home goods from catalogs. At her food stall, Silvia sells pozole [hominy stew], coffee, punch, quesadillas, pambazos [sandwiches dipped in pepper sauce and filled with potatoes and chorizo], tostadas [fried tortillas with toppings], beef and tongue tacos, chili-braised beef and pork, soups, and gorditas [stuffed corn cakes].

She asks for this loan to make improvements to her business and make it more presentable. Thanks to the time she has spent on her business, Silvia has been able to buy appliances, cooking utensils, and a grill, as well as to pay off debts and contribute to her family's finances.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business to make it more presentable.

loans.name: Dilaram

texts.ru: Диларам, 35 лет, замужем, с супругом воспитывают 2 дочерей и 2 сыновей. Дети дошкольного и школьного возраста Диларам после окончания школы вышла замуж за Бакытбека и вместе они стали заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начали с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Диларам достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 11,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Диларам имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 14 овец. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел 2,40 ГА на обработку и посадку фасоли, перца и клевера. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. Супруг работает частным водомером, то есть в сезон при поливе делит воду на полив земли местному населению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Диларам обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку селитры и удобрений для обработки земли. Диларам и ее семья намерены подготовить землю для посева. Доходы от кредита Диларам планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует купить семейную автомашину.
texts.en:
Dilaram is 35 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising two daughters and two sons.  After finishing high school, Dilaram married Bakytbek and together, they started raising crops and raising livestock.  They started their business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Dilaram achieved some success in expanding their business.  Currently, their monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).  Today, Dilaram has two milk cows and 14 sheep.  

They also have 2.4 hectares of land where they plant beans, peppers and clover.  Her spouse and her children help Dilaram with running this business.  Her spouse works as a private water administrator, who rations the local water for watering of the fields.  In order to advance her business, Dilaram turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase fertilizer.  Dilaram and her family are planning to get the fields ready for sowing.  Profits from her business, Dilaram plans to reinvest into her small household and in the future, to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for cultivation of crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer necessary for his business.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали 25 лет. Он женат и имеет 5 летнего ребенка. Рачабали с семьей живет с родительском доме и там же он занимается деятельностью животноводства. Рачабали около 2 лет занимается скотоводством и параллельно растениеводством. Но основная его деятельность и основной доход является животноводства. Рачабали с детства помогал отцу по работе на скотном дворе и научился многому от отца, но как бизнес он стал заниматься скотоводством только 2 года назад. На данный момент у Рачабали есть малое количество скота, и он решил взять кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота и тем самым увеличить свой доход от бизнеса.
texts.en: Rajabali is 25 years old. He is married and has a five-year-old child. Rajabali and his family live in his parents' house, and there he keeps livestock. Rajabali has been keeping livestock and farming for about two years. However, his primary occupation and main source of income is keeping the livestock. Since childhood, Rajabali has been helping his father work in the barnyard, and he has learned a lot from his father. He only started doing this as a business two years ago. Currently, Rajabali has few cattle, so he has decided to take out a loan to increase his livestock and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: buy a couple of cattle.

loans.name: Imomali

texts.ru:
Имомали 43-летний продавец. Он занимается продажей фруктов и овощей в своей торговой точке в районе Вахш. Имомали женат, является отцом одного сына и двух дочерей. Вот уже 9 лет как Имомали обеспечивает свою семью за счет своего малого торгового бизнеса. Супруга ему помогает в деятельности. Имомали сейчас просит кредит для закупки партии сезонных фруктов и овощей. Увеличив ассортимент товара, он увеличит количество продаж. 
Имомали имеет большие планы на будущее. Он хочет открыть продуктовый магазин рядом с домом.
texts.en: Imomali is a 43 year-old shop keeper.  He sells fruits and vegetables at a market stall in Vakhsh.  Imomali is married and is a father to one son and to two daughters.  Imomali has been providing for his family in this manner for over 9 years.  His wife helps him with running this business.  Imomali is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables.  By increasing the assortment of goods, he will boost his sales.  Imomali has big plans for his future, he dreams of opening his own grocery store next to his house.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables to boost his sales

loans.name: Meliboy

texts.ru: Мелибой женатый мужчина. Ему 31 год. У него двое детей. Его жена швея. Она берет заказы на шитье платьев у себя дома. Мелибой тоже работает дома. Он занимается скотоводством. Выращивает крупно рогатых скотов у себя дома. Такой вид деятельности прибыльная, но и требует труда и усилий. Животноводство являет одним из основных деятельности на районах и деревнях республики Таджикистан. Мелибой работал на скотном дворе с юных лет, но как бизнес, скотоводством, но начал заниматься 7 лет назад. В работе ему помогает его брат. Мелибой ответственно относится к своей работе. И всерьез решил расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен взять кредит и купить несколько голов скота и увеличить поголовья продаваемого скота. Таким решением он хочет увеличить свой доход и накопить денег на образование его детей.
texts.en: Meliboy is a married man of 31 years.  He has two children and his wife works as a seamstress.  She works from home by taking orders for sewing of dresses.  Meliboy also works at home, he raises cattle.  This is a profitable business, but it requires a lot of hard work.  Raising of livestock is the predominant activity in the rural areas of Tajikistan.  Meliboy has been raising cattle since he was very young, however as a business activity, he has been doing it for 7 years.  His brother helps him run this business.  Meliboy approaches this work very responsibly and today, he decided to expand it.  He is asking for a loan to purchase additional cattle in order to expand his herd.  He wants to increase the profits from his business so he can save some money for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hard working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Juliet has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes for ladies and children. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay her house rent. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 47 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Agnes has been working hard to manage her sewing business, which sells tablecloths. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more threads and hooks, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and employ other people. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to have bigger orders. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more threads and hooks.

loans.name: Ana Yudy

texts.es:
Ana, es soltera tiene una hija, vive solo con su hija, debido a la necesidad e degenerar ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hija, por iniciativa propia inicio su negocio de venta de lociones y cosméticos, lo realiza de lunes a sábado, hasta el momento no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en realizar esta actividad.
Con la inversión realizara la compra de cremas corporales, lociones, esmaltes, labiales, etc., con lo que podrá mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes, tendrá mayores ventas, sus ingresos aumentaran y cancelara sus deudas.
Su sueño es dar apoyo a su hija para que continúe sus estudios y culmine una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is single and lives alone with her daughter. Due to the need to bring in income to cover expenses for herself and her daughter, she started a business selling lotions and cosmetics. She works Monday through Saturday and so far has not had any problems with her business.

With this investment she will buy body creams, lotions, nail polish, lip stick, etc, which will improve the options for her customers and increase her sales and income so that she can pay off her debts. Her dream is to support her daughter so that she can continue her studies and get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy body creams, lotions, nail polish and lipstick.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, es soltera tiene tres hijos en edades de 24, 20 y 18 años de edad, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, para tener los recursos económicos con los que cubre los gastos familiares hace 13 años instalo un molino nixtamal y una tienda en su residencia, atiende su negocio de lunes  a domingo y es apoyada por sus hijos.
Invertirá en la compra de discos para el molino y productos para la tienda tales como jabón, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas entre otros, de esta forma podrá fortalecer su negocio con lo que espera tener más clientes satisfechos, sus ventas aumentara, tendrá más ganancias.
Su sueño es mantener activo su negocio y dar a sus hijos mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Maria is single and has three children ages 24, 20 and 18 who are financially dependent on her. In order to have the money to care for her family, 13 years ago she installed a corn mill and a store in her home. The store is open every day, with help from her children.

She will invest in the purchase of disks for the corn mill, and products for the store like soap, sugar, drinks, snacks and other things. This way she can strengthen her business which she hopes will mean more satisfied customers, increased sales and greater profits. Her dream is to keep her business active and give her children the best food, health and clothing.

loans.use: to buy disks for the corn mill, and products for her store.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and two children, and attending school. His wife doesn’t work so he is the main and only income source of his family. He is a brave blacksmith working in this domain for the past 12 years. Two years ago, he was able to open his own shop after making the needed savings to launch his business. Currently, he plans to strengthen his business operations by purchasing new tools and an electrical  generator for his business by receiving a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Abbas has to develop his business to gain a higher income and improve the family’s way of living. As for his future plans, he hopes to expand his business into other areas and start to provide a new community with his competent and endowed skills.

loans.use: purchasing new tools and an electrical generator for his business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is from Ashotavan village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and has been involved in agriculture. They own a big farm which includes livestock of chickens, beehives, pig, sheep, and cows. They also own arable land where they cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables. Aida doesn't work and her husband has retirement pension so the only source of family's income comes from agriculture. For improving her farm and feeding the livestock during the winter season Aida needs financial support. As this is Aida's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Aida and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Sope Sa Dieukeur Group

texts.fr: SOPE SA DIEUKEUR est un groupement composé de 05 personnes qui vivent dans la même maison et ont une même ambition. Ils travaillent tous dans le même marché et cote à cote. Seynabou est leur présente c’est elle qui a levée la main en serment sur la photo. Elle fait l’achat et la vente de viande de bœuf en détail  et a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Ainsi ce prêt sera destiné à renforcer son fond de roulement. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir elle souhaite devenir un fournisseur potentiel dans le marché de sa commune.
texts.en:
Sope Sa Dieukeur is a group made up of five people who live in the same house, and share the same ambition.  They work side by side in the same market.  

Seynabou is their president, and is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She buys and sells beef to retail clients and has more than five years' experience in this business.  

Seynabou helps her husband with the daily expenses of their family and the school expenses of their children.  She will use her loan to strengthen her working capital.  Seynabou starts her working day at 8am and finishes at 5pm.  

In the future, she would like to become a supplier for her local market.

loans.use: to buy beef for resale.

loans.name: Kayirma

texts.ru: Кайырме 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына, сын-школьник. У Кайырмы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кайырма занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS, была приобретена одна корова. Благодаря упорному труду Кайырмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется уже: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 15 овец. У Кайырмы большой опыт в разведении скота. Дважды в год она привлекает ветеринара на ветеринарные прививки для всего скота. Также стрижет шерсть овец дважды в год и сдает реализаторам. Кайырма доит коров, все коровы у нее дойные, готовит из молока сыр, творог, сметану и кефир и реализовывает его оптовым продавцам за наличный расчет. Молочная продукция свежая и домашняя. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайырма обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота.  Доходы от будущего кредита Кайырма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Kayirma is 54 years old, married, and raising a school-aged son. Kayirma has a secondary education. The livestock business is the family's primary source of income. Kayirma started this business 24 years ago when she bought a cow for 5,000 KGS. Because of Kayirma's hard work, her farm currently boasts four milk cows, one horse, and fifteen sheep. Kayirma has extensive experience breeding livestock. Twice a year she brings in a veterinarian to vaccinate all of her livestock. She also shears her sheep twice a year and sells the fleece. Kayirma milks all of her cows, making cheese, cottage cheese, sour cream and kefir, which she then sells to wholesalers. Her dairy products are fresh and homemade. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Kayirma approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Kayirma flans to use profits from the loan to further expand her livestock, and she plans to save enough money to build a new home.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали одного сына, сыну 22 года, находится в России на заработках, ежемесячно высылает часть своей зарплаты на поддержку родителей. Бурмакан очень уважаема среди своих сельчан, имеет большой опыт работы в сельском хозяйстве. У Бурмакан  - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурмакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 кобылы, 23 овцы. Бурмакан ежегодно в сезон с апреля по сентябрь месяцы доит кобыл и готовит национальный напиток, который называется "кымыз" на продажу. Кымыз - очень питательный и полезный для организма напиток. А также доит коров круглогодично, молоко сдает реализаторам за наличный расчет. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового дома.
texts.en: Burmakan is 51 years old, married, and raised a son with her husband. Her son is 22 years old. He is working in Russia, and every month he sends part of his salary home to support his parents. Burmakan is very respected among the villagers. She has extensive experience in agriculture. Burmakan has a secondary education. The livestock business is the family's primary source of income. Burmakan started it 26 years ago when she bought 4,000 KGS worth of livestock. Because of Burmakan's hard work, her farm currently boasts five dairy cows, two mares, and 23 sheep. Every year from April to September, Burmakan milks the mares to make the traditional drink called "kumis" to sell. Kumis is a very nutritious and healthy drink. She milks the cows year-round and sells the milk. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KGS. In order to further expand her farm, Burmakan approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a horse for breeding. Burmakan plans to invest profits from this loan into increasing her livestock, and she plans to save enough money to buy a new home.

loans.use: buy a horse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, soft drinks and other items for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Judith has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells children's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for all ages, and will help Judith to generate greater profits. Some of the profits will be used to pay fees for herself. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for all ages.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. One of his children is currently in school. For the past 15 years, Wilber has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells dresses, skirts and other clothes. 

To help expand his business, Wilber has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses, skirts, and shirts and will help Wilber to generate greater profits and get school fees to educate his children. Wilber hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch of his store. 

Wilber is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilber who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, skirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a hard-working women. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 5 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells ladies clothing and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and increase on personal income. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has 2 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells beans, rice and groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair plaiting, treatments and weaving. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids, oils and shampoos, and will help her to generate greater profits, some of which will be used to educate her child. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy braids, oils and shampoos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, lace, elastic, thread, etc.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a hardworking woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 3 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her rice business, which deals in selling rice on a wholesale basis. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, and will help Teopista to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her siblings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, oil, bread, sugar, eggs. milk, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the region of Iganga in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Zahara has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells rice, maize and beans. 

To help expand her business, Zahara has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Zahara to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Zahara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Sad 1 Group

texts.fr: Solidarité Action Développement est une fédération composée de plusieurs groupements appelé SAD ; Monsieur Mamadou est le président du GIE SAD 1, c’est un groupement mixte composé de 3femmes et 8hommes qui habitent dans le même village et faisant tous la même activité. On le reconnait sur la photo par sa main levée. Il évolue dans l’agriculture et le maraichage, il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des intrants et semences de choux, carotte, oignon pour  la culture du maraichage. IL est marié et père de famille et a une expérience de plus de 12ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 06h du matin pour la terminer à 19h du soir. A l’avenir il souhaite grâce aux crédits de l’institution être un fournisseur potentiel en oignon.
texts.en:
Solidarité Action Développement (SAD) is a federation which is made up of several groups.  Mamadou is the president of the Economic Interest Group (GIE) Sad 1.  This is a mixed group of three women and eight men who live in the same village, and have the same type of business.  

Mamadou is seen in the photo with his hand raised.  He is a vegetable grower, and will use his loan to buy fertilizer and seed for cabbages, carrots and onions.  Mamadou is married and has children.  He has more than twelve years' experience in his business.  He starts his working day at 6am and finishes at 7pm.

In the future, with further loans from the field partner, Mamadou would like to become a potential onion supplier.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children, some of them still attending school and only one working to help his father supplement the family’s income. Hasan has owned a small territory for the past 20 years where he sells spare car parts. With his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase a large quantity of spare parts at good prices, which will augment his business sales and thus his revenue. Hasan requires this loan as he desperately needs to continue supporting his family as much as he can to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of spare car parts to resell.

loans.name: Lilian Maria

texts.es:
La señora Lilian  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en  una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas,  el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Lilian necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal  para  seguir elaborando sus tortillas de  esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar. 
Doña Lilian espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos.
Doña Lilian espera que su negocio siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Diciembre   2013
texts.en:
Lilian is a hardworking and responsible lady who lives with her family in a southern Honduras community.  She makes and sells tortillas and is well known in her community, which makes the demand for her products high.

Lilian needs this loan to buy corn, firewood, and limestone so she can continue making tortillas and be able to count on this income which is very important to her household. 

Lilian expects to be able to continue with her business with the help of this loan, and be able to continue meeting her customer demand, which has increased and can be noted with her improved quality of life and increased income.

Lilian expects that her business will continue growing and become one of the best known in the community so she can continue supporting her family so that they can have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – December 2013

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mauricio Asael

texts.es:
Mauricio, está acompañado, tienen un hijo, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Se dedica a comprar por mayoreo productos de loza y luego venderlos, inicio su negocio hace unos 6 años y lo atiende de lunes  a sábado.
 Comprará comales, cantaros y ollas, para tener suficiente producto con lo que cumplirá con sus pedidos, espera mejorar sus ventas y tener más ingresos para cancelar las cuotas y darle a su familia mejores condiciones alimenticias, de vestuario y educación.
Aspira seguir trabajando por tener un negocio más estable y rentable.
texts.en:
Mauricio is married and they have one son.  He lives with his wife and their 14-year-old son.  He works buying ceramic dishware wholesale and then selling them.  He started his business 6 years ago and works from Monday to Saturday.  

With this loan, he will buy comals, pitchers, and pots so as to have enough goods to meet his orders.  He hopes to improve his sales and obtain enough extra income to pay off his loans and also give his family an improved quality of life (in terms of food, clothing, and education).  He hopes to continue working so his business will be more stable and productive.

loans.use: buy comals, pitchers, and pots.

loans.name: Charos

texts.ru: Чарос родилась в 1977 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Намоз предоставляет услуги строителя. Чарос занимается скотоводством. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 4 лет. Постепенно, год за годом она развевает свой бизнес. Чарос начала свой бизнес с 2 голов мелко рогатого скота. Данное время она имеет 4 голов мелко рогатого скота и одну корову. Чарос откармливает скот дома. Она недавно отремонтировала свой дом. Теперь она хочет купить мягкую мебель для своего дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Charos was born in 1977. She is married and raising two children. Her husband Namoz works as a builder. Charos is engaged in animal husbandry. She has been doing this business for over 4 years. Gradually, year by year, she has grown her business. Charos started her business with two heads of small-horned cattle. Now, she has 4 small-horned cattle and one cow. Charos fattens the cattle at home. She recently remodeled her house. Now, she wants to buy furniture for her home. She has requested a loan of 3000 Somons to buy furniture. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 53 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming back into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en:
Slyvia is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi, in the region of Mukono, in Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Slyvia has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, in which she sells charcoal and wood. 

To help expand her business, Slyvia has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase business assets, wood, and charcoal and it will help Slyvia to generate greater profits and increase her production. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become a supplier. 

Slyvia is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy stock for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 48-year-old single lady who has been working as a beauty expert, specializing in makeup and nail care for ten years. She is a hard worker who provides beauty services to customers in their own homes. She hasn't established her own beauty salon because of a lack of cash, although almost all of her customers prefer to have this kind of service at home because they feel pampered.
 
Rita is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and New Year's newly released cosmetics and accessories that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

She hopes that in the future she might be capable of establishing her own beauty salon and diversifying her products, in addition to increasing the services she provides to make sure that her customers are happy and satisfied.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special Christmas and New Year's newly released cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 4 years, she has been working hard to manage her business of making and selling pancakes. 

To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy ingredients for making more pancakes, which will help Zaina to generate greater profits and have a bigger and better business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Zaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making more pancakes.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Azizi is 27 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. None of his children are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Azizi has been working hard to manage his clothing sales business. He sells dresses, tops, skirts, and t-shirts. 

To help expand his business, Azizi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses, bedsheets, shirts, skirts, jeans, and baby clothes and will help Azizi to generate greater profits and take care of his family's basic needs. Azizi hopes that in the future he will be able to stock more and sell in bulk. 

Azizi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Azizi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, bedsheets, shirts, skirts, jeans, and baby clothes.

loans.name: Jassy

texts.en:
Jassy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the region of Fortportal in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. Three of her children are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Jassy has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells coats, trousers, shirts, and ties. 

To help expand business, Jassy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more coats, suits, shirts and other items and will help Jassy to generate greater profits and achieve her goal of educating her children. Jassy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business. 

Jassy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jassy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more coats, suits, shirts and other items.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 26 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. Three of her children are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Dinah has been working hard to manage her electrical shop, which sells cables, mitre boxes, bulbs, and sockets. 

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cables, bulbs, sockets, earpieces, and memory cards and will help Dinah to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living and income. Dinah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another shop and give her children an opportunity for further studies. 

Dinah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dinah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase cables, bulbs, sockets, earpieces, and memory cards.

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat, a married father of three children, all of school-going age, lives in the Muranga area of Central Kenya. He has practiced farming for 10 years, growing and selling tea and a few other crops. He says that farming is enjoyable because it brings in good returns. His challenge is a lack of good markets for his products.

Moffat chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of its affordable low interest rate. He will use it to construct a cow shed. This loan will result in more income and help him pay school fees for his children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To construct a cow shed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old. He is a father of four. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 46 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 54 years old. She is married with five children. She has spent fifteen years in the farming business. With the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to use during maize production in order to increase the harvest. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old. He is a father of four children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

texts.en:
Innocent is 37 years old. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María  nació en Latacunga, perteneciente a la parroquia La Matriz, en la provincia de Cotopaxi República del Ecuador tiene 43 años de edad, está casada con Marco de 41 años, tiene cinco hijos, los mismos que viven con ellos, actualmente tienen su casa propia en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia Tanicuchí, sector muy reconocido por ser una zona agrícola y lechera, el barrio se llama Santa Ana Alto, viven ahí desde hace 18 años, ya que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo lograron construirla.
Por la falta de recursos económico en un inicio María tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, es por esto que se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. María ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  con el esfuerzo y sacrifico de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en la compra de más animales y siembras esto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. María  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María was born in Latacunga, which belongs to the parish of La Matriz, in the province of Cotopaxi, Republic of Ecuador. She is 43 years old and married to Marco, age 41. She has five children, and they all live together in the family's own house in the city of Latacunga, in the parish of Tanicuchí, a sector highly recognized for its agriculture and dairy production. The neighborhood is called Santa Ana Alto, and they have lived there for 18 years, since with great sacrifice and effort they succeeded in building their house. 

Because of the lack of economic resources at the beginning, María had to look for a way to help her husband cover the expenses. For this reason she works raising and selling small animals. María has shown herself to be a hard-working and enterprising woman. With the effort and sacrifice of her parents, she was able to finish secondary school. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying more animals and some plants. This will help her improve her income. María would like to extend her sincere appreciation and congratulations to the Alternativa Foundation in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible this growth in her personal and professional life.

loans.use: to invest in buying more animals and some plants, allowing her to improve her income.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old. He is single and he has spent fifteen years in farming.  He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Sad 2 Group

texts.fr: Le GIE SAD 2 est composé de 10 personnes qui habitent dans le même village et ils pratiquent le même métier. Le Président du groupement SAD 2 est un homme âgé de 52ans qui est marié et père de famille. Il s’appelle El hadji Malick et c’est lui qui a levé la main sur la photo. Il évolue dans l’agriculture et le maraichage. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter des intrants et semences comme les choux, carotte, navet  et oignon pour faire la culture du maraichage.il a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa femme et ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir il veut devenir le fournisseur potentiel de légumes pour les petits vendeurs.
texts.en:
The Economic Interest Group (GIE), Sad 2, is made up of ten people who live in the same village and work in the same field of business.  

The president of the group, El hadji Malick, is seen in the photo with his hand raised.  El hadji Malick is a 52-year-old, married man with children.  He works in agriculture and grows vegetables, and has requested this loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds such as cabbage, carrot, turnip and onion.  El hadji Malick has more than ten years' experience in this area.  He is responsible for the day-to-day expenses for his wife and their children.  His working day starts at six in the morning and finishes at six in the evening.

In the future, El hadji Malick would like to become a potential supplier of vegetables for small retailers

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for vegetable growing.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

María tiene 52 años, vive en unión libre y ninguno de sus hijos depende económicamente de ella; por lo que se todo su ingreso va para ella y su esposo. Ella se describe como una persona trabajadora, que le gusta emprender y no le gusta la mediocridad.

María se dedica a rentar y administrar tres departamentos de los que se ha podido hacer a lo largo de su vida, los cuales los tiene todo bajo contrato. Pide este préstamo para hacer una remodelación en el departamento donde vive, haciéndose algunas reparaciones necesarias.

Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado ir comprando algunas cosas para su hogar, y su principal reto es comprar otra cosa para también rentarla.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

María is 52 years old, is married (in a free union) and all of her children are financially independent.  For this reason, all of her income goes to her and her husband.  She describes herself as a hardworking person who likes to learn and doesn't content herself with mediocrity.

María works renting and administering 3 apartments which throughout her life she eventually came to own.  They are all under contract.  She is asking for this loan so she can remodel the apartment where she lives, making certain necessary repairs.

Through her work efforts, she has been able to gradually buy things for her house.  Her main goal is to buy another apartment and then rent it out.

loans.use: remodel the apartment where she lives.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 37 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old. He is a father of one child. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 31 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production in order to increase the harvest. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, Uganda. A single woman, for the past two years she has been working hard to manage her hotel, which sells food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more food to prepare. This will help her to generate greater profits and provide for the basic needs for her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a retail shop. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food to prepare.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a farmer from Ditavan village of the Tavush region. She lives with her four school age children (three sons - 11, 9, and 6 years old, and an 8-year-old daughter) and her father-in-law. To take care of her family Anna is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding pigs, and cultivation of wheat, corn, grass, and several fruits (plums, quince, pomegranates, figs, blood oranges, apples, pears, and walnuts). With the help of her father-in-law, Anna sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustained way, Anna needs a loan of USD 600 to purchase forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock. As this is Anna’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Anna and her large family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase forage (grass and combined forage) for the livestock.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 29 year old Ugandan married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a stationary shop where he generates income. He is also a government employee. He started his business for his wife to work in so that they can increase their income and look after their family. He hopes to educate his three children and start up an internet cafe in his town in the future. Challenges of competition from people with similar businesses and high electricity power interruptions affect his business. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy more stationary to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stationary.

loans.name: Mercedes Pamela

texts.es:
Mercedes una joven ecuatoriana emprendedora tiene 22 años nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz perteneciente a  la República del Ecuador, es soltera vive en casa propia con sus hermanas, está estudiando en la universidad  y para solventar sus gastos tiene un pequeño negocio de que consiste en la elaboración de empanadas, yogurt, y leche de soya, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien por muchos años se dedicó a esta actividad.
Hoy necesita que se le ayude con un crédito que lo invertirá en  la compra de una cocina y un horno industrial esto servirá para minimizar tiempo y esfuerzo en la elaboración de su producto, Mercedes se dedica de 4 a 5 horas diarias a la producción de las empanadas y demás.
Mercedes  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an entrepreneurial young woman from Ecuador. She is 22 years old and was born in the city of Latacunga in the La Matriz parish in the Republic of Ecuador. She is single and lives in her own house with her sisters. She is studying at the university, and in order to cover her expenses she has a small business that consists of making empanadas, yogurt, and soy milk. She learned this business from her mother, who did this work for many years.

Today she needs help with a loan that she will use to buy a stove and an industrial oven. This will serve to minimize time and effort when making her product. Mercedes spends 4 to 5 hours daily making empanadas and other items.

Mercedes wants to extend her sincere thanks and greetings to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible to grow in her work and personal life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and an industrial oven

loans.name: Ermogenes

texts.es: Ermógenes, de 46 años, está casado y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Ermógenes consiste en el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, el se levanta muy temprano para alistarse y salir a las diversas calles de la ciudad en busca de los eventuales pasajeros quienes requieren transportarse de un lugar a otro. Gracias a los 12 años que lleva realizando este trabajo ha aprendido a conocer a sus clientes y se ha ganado la confianza de muchos de ellos lo cual le permite ser solicitado para brindar servicios particulares siendo contratado por largas horas de trabajo. Su carisma y alegría son su principal arma para sobrellevar el día a día laboral y relacionarse mejor con sus pasajeros. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que el puede disponer de su tiempo ya que trabaja principalmente en horarios de mayor demanda del público que son en horas escolares de entrada a los colegios y centros de labores de las personas, el resto del día trabaja transitando por las distintas calles de la ciudad, le está yendo bien ya que como su mototaxi es propio no tiene que pagar a alguien por el alquiler, tiene como planes a futuro poder comprar dos mototaxis más para así ampliar su flota vehicular y poder alquilarlos. En esta oportunidad solicitara s/.2000, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Con el monto solicitado  comprará algunas piezas y enviará su mototaxi al taller para que le hagan algunas reparaciones.
texts.en: Ermógenes, 46 years old, is married and has 3 children, with whom he lives in his own house. Ermógenes' work consists of transporting passengers in his mototaxi. He gets up very early to get ready and go out on the different streets of the city looking for casual passengers who need transportation from one place to another. Thanks to the 12 years that he has been doing this work, he has learned to know his customers and he has earned the trust of many of them. This allows him to be requested to provide private services and be contracted for long hours of work. His charisma and happiness are his principal weapon in order to bear the day-to-day of work and relate better to his passengers. What he likes about his work is that he can be in charge of his time, since he principally works at times of higher public demand, which is when school starts and people are going to work. The rest of the day he works traveling around the different streets of the city. It is going well for him, since as his mototaxi is his own he does not have to pay someone to rent it. His future plan is to be able to buy two more mototaxis in order to expand his vehicle fleet and be able to rent them. At this time he will request 2000 soles, so he thanks all of the people who continue to trust him to again take on this financing, which will help him to increase his working capital. He knows that he will again have to be very responsible and above all very punctual. With the amount requested, he will buy some parts and he will send his mototaxi to the shop so that they can make some repairs.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El joven Miguel tiene 24 años y es Soltero,  estudia la carrera  mecánica en una universidad muy reconocida de la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Miguel trabaja confeccionando prendas de vestir como ropa deportiva el tiene su taller que se encuentra en  la Zona de 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y Miguel va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo financiar los gastos escolares de matriculación, Materiales y/o útiles para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 5 años.
