Miguel enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse al 100% a su estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante. su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is 24 years old and single.  He is studying mechanics at a well-known university in the city of La Paz.  He is working making clothes, such as sport clothes, in order to pay his studies.  He has a workshop in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto.  This is Miguel's first loan with the institution and he will use it to cover various costs related to his studies, such as tuition fees, materials and tools to finish his five-year study programme.  Miguel is facing challenges in his studies - because of his work, he is not able to dedicate himself 100% to his university work. However, this young man has the will to keep going and to get ahead.  When he finishes his studies, Miguel wants to practice what he has learned at university and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for study tools for his university course in mechanics.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is married, with four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of her late sister's children. She has a business selling charcoal and she has been in this business for nine years. 

Dorothy has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal.  

She works at the market seven days out of every week and she sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and she also wants to buy a plot of land and to build her own house. 

Dorothy decided to join MCDT SACCO because she wanted additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is single with three children. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 30 years. She works seven days a week.  

Deborah has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 2,700,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy local gin, local brew, crates of beer and soda. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked pub and also to  build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent for the shop.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local Gin, local brew, crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming inputs.

loans.name: Ana Ester

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia se dedica a la venta de lácteos, el negocio inicio por la necesidad de tener más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, atiende su negocio ella misma con un poco de ayuda de sus hijos, por el momento no ha tenido ninguna en administrarlo.
El capital lo utilizara para adquirir crema y quesos de distinta clase de esta manera su negocio tendrá producto fresco y de calidad, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos, tener más ganancias con las que cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
Sueña con que su negocio crezca poco a poco y mejorar su economía.
texts.en: Ana is married with three children. She lives in her own house. She makes a living by selling dairy products. She started her business because of the necessity to have more income to cover family expenses. She looks after the business herself with a little bit of help from her children. For the time being she has not had any of them managing it. She will use the loan to buy cream and cheeses of a different type. This way, her business will have fresh and quality product. She hopes to increase her sales, have more satisfied clients, and make more profits with which she will fulfill her economic commitments. She dreams about her business growing little by little and improving her money situation.

loans.use: to buy cream and cheeses

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 14 años de edad, hace ocho años debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia emprendió un negocio que consiste en cultivar maíz y atender una tienda, por el momento no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, bebidas, jabón. Con lo que surtirá su negocio, espera aumentar ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, Atraer nuevos clientes y poder cancelar sus deudas para tener mayor liquidez.
Sueña con apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is married, and she lives with her husband and their three children; ages 20, 16, and 14.  Eight years ago, due to the need to generate income to cover the family necessities, she began a business that consists of growing corn and tending to a store.  She has had no difficulties in her business so far.

She will invest in the purchase of sugar, beans, candy, drinks, and soap.  With this purchase she will stock her business.  She hopes to increase sales, improve her income, attract new customers, and to be able to pay off her debts in order to have more liquidity.

She dreams of supporting her children in their education and of them becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, candy, drinks, and soap.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is single with four children; two of her children go to school. She doesn't have any additional family members. She operates a retail shop and sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, crates of soda, and other soft drinks. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease her transportation, own a fully stocked retail shop, and educate her children up to university level.

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, crates of soda, and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años de edad, para cubrir los gastos de su casa se dedica al cultivar maíz y frijol, crianza de ganado y tiene granja de pollos, son oficios que aprendió desde hace mucho tiempo.
En esta ocasión comprara concentrado, pollo, abono, fertilizantes e insecticida, con lo que fortalecerá su negocio, con lo que espera seguir trabajando, aumentar sus ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos y cancelar sus deudas.
Sueña con dar una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Gustavo lives with his wife and his children, aged 15, 10, and 8 years old respectively.  In order to pay the household bills, Gustavo works growing corn and beans, and raising cattle and chickens. He learned these trades a long time ago.

On this occasion Gustavo will buy feed, chickens, manure, fertilisers, and insecticide and use them to strengthen his business.  He hopes to continue working, to increase his sales, to have more satisfied customers, and to pay off his debts.

Gustavo dreams of providing his children with a good quality education so that they can become professionals, and he dreams of continuing to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, chickens, manure, fertilisers, and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es:
Santos, vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), también en diferentes épocas del año siembra hortalizas. Por su experiencia administra muy bien su negocio.
El capital lo utilizara apara comprar fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas y pagara mano de obra para que el ayuden a preparar la tierra y sembrar maíz. Espera tener una producción abundante, granos de calidad, mejorar sus ventas y tener una economía estable.
Sueña con ampliar el área de cultivo y ampliar su vivienda para darle un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his life partner and his little one-year-old son. To cover family expenses, he dedicates himself to the cultivation of basic staple grains (rice and beans). Also, during different seasons of the year he also sows vegetable seeds. For his level of experience, he manages his business well.
The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, manure, insecticides, and pay day laborers to help him prepare his land and plant corn. He hopes to have an abundant production, high grain quality, and improve sales for a stable home economy. 
He dreams of expanding the area he has under cultivation and expand his living space to give his family a safe home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and insecticides and pay day laborers to help plant his corn crops.

loans.name: Gabriel Narciso

texts.es: El señor  Gabriel es un humilde cliente habitante del municipio de Juigalpa, junto a su esposa procreo 4 hijos de los cuales solamente una depende económicamente de él quien estudia la escuela secundaria,	don Gabriel labora como policía municipal para una institución del estado, solicita el crédito para cambiar  el techo de su vivienda en la parte frontal, lo que se encuentra en mal estado, siendo esto una gran dificultad para  habitar en mejores condiciones, gracias al apoyo de financiamiento  podrá vencer esta limitante,  brindando mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a humble client who lives in the city of Juigalpa.  Together with his wife, they have 4 children.  Only one of their children is financially dependent on them and she is currently studying in middle school.  Gabriel works as a local police officer for a state institution.

He is asking for a loan to replace the front part of the roof of their house, which is currently in very bad condition and makes it difficult to inhabit.  Thanks to the help that this loan will give him, he will be able to overcome this problem and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: buy sheet metal and wooden beams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy (mainly organic) fertilizers and to help put a fence around his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to renovate his farm.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Martha tiene 50 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo; con el cual inició el negocio de servicio de payasos para fiestas que tienen actualmente. Iniciaron vendiendo varitas de luces en fiestas infantiles, y cuando en una de ellas faltó el payaso, su hijo improvisó un número (maquillado con los cosméticos de ella) y todo salió muy bien; por lo que decidieron iniciar el negocio de payasos.

Martha y su hijo se encuentran en un puesto fijo, donde además de los payasos tienen animadores para apertura de negocio, venden piñatas, varitas de fantasía y arreglos para todo tipo de eventos.

Este préstamo lo pide para comprar mercancía necesaria para animar en los diferentes eventos que son contratados. Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo Martha ha logrado tener estabilidad económica para ella y su hijo, y su reto es ampliar aún más su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Martha is 50 years old and single. She has one son, with whom she started the party clown business that they have currently.  They started out selling glow sticks at children’s parties, and one day, when one of the parties was missing a clown, her son improvised a clown act (wearing Martha’s make-up).  Everything went very well, so they decided to start the party clown business.  

Martha and her son have steady work; and in addition to clowns, they provide entertainers for business openings. They sell piñatas, magic wands, and decorations for all types of events.

She is seeking this loan in order to purchase the supplies that she needs for party entertainment at the different events for which she has contracts.  Thanks to the effort that she has put into her work, Martha has been able to achieve financial stability for herself and her son.  Her goal is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for entertaining at parties.

loans.name: Purabi

texts.en:
Purabi is a woman of Petkathi village in Mayanaguri, Jaipaiguri District. She is a 38-year-old woman, married to Haren. They have three children studying in class VI (grade 6), class VII (grade 7), and class IX (grade 9) respectively. She wants her children to lead a very successful life with a good education. Purabi is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name.

 She has her own incense (aggarbati) business. She is experienced in this field, so that’s why she has chosen this business. After taking the loan from BJS, she wants to improve her business and wants to purchase raw materials for her business. She supplies incense to the local shops, and her incense is in great demand in the locality. 

The strike of the laborers creates a great difficulty in her business. But any difficulties cannot stop her from growing in her life, as well as to flourish in her business. As she is a very courageous lady, she gives support to her husband and family. Her self-confidence and enormous skill make her a good entrepreneur, which helps her to increase the economic and social condition of the family. 

She gives her best regards to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her incense business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron, and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with two children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a restaurant  business and has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings(UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more food stuff, such as bunches of greens, bananas, beef, rice and beans. She works seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant, buy a plot of land, and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more food stuff, such as bunches of greens, bananas, beef, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with four children; three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming, and has been in this business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings(UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of poultry feeds. She works from home seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only.

Her major business challenges includes thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to own 2,000 chicken and educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family

loans.use: to buy more bags of poultry feeds.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her mother. Prossy runs a pub and has been in this business for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the pub and sells retail seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include customers who default on debt and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked pub and make enough profits to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest rates. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin .

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two orphans. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She goes door-to-door selling used clothes six days per week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. She aspires to secure a permanent business premise and to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest rates. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Fausta Karolina

texts.es:
La señora Fausta    de 33  años de edad, tiene tres  hijos   que depende de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa, ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Fausta se dedica desde hace 11 años al negocio de venta de achinería y costura, sus clientes son los estudiantes y policía ya que le confecciona los uniformes, también vende juguetes paro los niños en época de navidad.
Doña Fausta es una mujer emprendedora que desea y se esfuerza día con día para salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de materia prima para la costura como agujas, hilos, tijeras, telas y también desea  comprar una maquina nueva para costura.
Doña Fausta con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir  trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es construir su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Fausta is 33 years old and has three children who are still dependent.  Fausta lives with her husband, in their own house, in a community in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

For eleven years, Fausta has had a business doing dressmaking work and also selling low-cost consumer goods.  Her main clients in the dressmaking work are students and police officers, for whom she produces uniforms.  She also sells children's toys during the Christmas period.

Fausta is an enterprising woman who wants to and puts in the effort every day to get ahead.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies for her dressmaking work: she will buy needles, threads, scissors, material and also wants to buy a new sewing machine.

With the help of this loan, Fausta plans to improve her income and her quality of life.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  Fausta's dream is build her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2013

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, scissors, and material for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of two children, neither of which go to school. She also takes care of her sisters. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works from home six days per week.. Her major business challenges include seasonality and theft. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to earn enough profits to start importing used clothes. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because no security is requested in order for one to get a loan. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre trabajador de 48 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos y un esposo ejemplar. 
Se ha ganado la vida a pulso, trabajando constantemente para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, comenzó su propio negocio independiente hace 17 años, vendiendo bolsos y maletas desde la sala de su casa, posteriormente se ubicó en el centro de la ciudad con el ánimo de aumentar sus ventas, trabaja solo todos los días de 9 am a 7 pm y, en temporada alta recibe el apoyo de su familia.
Con el ánimo de capitalizar su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (maletas, bolsos, riñoneras, manos libres), esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad para ofrecer en la temporada escolar que inicia, lo que le permitirá incrementar las ventas y por ende, las ganancias que obtiene.
Guillermo tiene como propósito ampliar más su negocio, fortalecerlo y acreditarlo con mayor cantidad de inventario, pues desea lograr una mejor rentabilidad y tener la capacidad de brindar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a hardworking, 48-year-old man who is the father of 3 exemplary children.  He has earned what he has through diligent effort, working constantly so his family can have everything they need.  He started his own business 17 years ago selling purses and suitcases from the living room of his house.  Later, she relocated to the downtown part of his city with the desire to increase his sales.  He works every day and by himself from 9 am to 7 pm and during the busy season he gets help from his family.

With the desire to increase the profitability of his business, he is asking for a loan to buy wholesale inventory (suitcases, purses, fanny packs, and backpacks).  This will allow him to have a greater variety to offer for the school year that is coming up, help him increase his sales, and as a result increase the profits that he will obtain.

Guillermo's goals include expanding his business, strengthening it, and increasing its inventory.  He wants to increase its profitability and have the opportunity to offer his family a better quality of life and greater well-being.

loans.use: buy wholesale inventory (suitcases, purses, fanny packs, and backpacks).

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita de 60 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos; pero solo una hija y una nieta vive con ella y su esposo. Ella estudio solamente hasta primer grado, en su niñez y juventud manifiesta que era muy difícil al acceso a la educación; sus padres con mucho esfuerzo pudieron criarlos entre medio de tanta pobreza. El esposo de Felicita, trabaja como agente de seguridad ganando el salario mínimo. 

Felicita administra su propia tienda de productos básicos desde hace 5 años, la que le ayuda a aportar ingresos a la familia, entre los productos que vende de encuentran: azúcar, café, arroz, golosinas, aceite, entre otros.  Anteriormente, trabajaba en una tortillería en la capital del país y los quehaceres en el hogar. Además, de la tienda también se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como gallinas y cerdos. La tienda,  está instalada en su casa y los horarios de atención son todos los  días.

El préstamo que está solicitando  a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar más azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, jugos, productos para el cuidado personal, etc. Y aprovechar de comprar a los proveedores mayor cantidad de productos, para obtener mejores precios, que le permitan tener abastecido el negocio y que le reduzcan los costos, así obtendrá mayor ganancia. 

Su sueño es, instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras y vender la producción en la tienda, que esto le garantice el sustento de su familia y desarrollando esta actividad sin tener que desplazarse a otro lugar lejos de su casa.
texts.en:
Felicita is 60 years old, is married, and is the mother of 4 children.  Only one daughter and one granddaughter live with her and her husband.  She only completed first grade in school and comments that it was very difficult to access education when she was young.  Her parents were able to raise them amid great poverty due to their dedication and effort.  Felicita's husband works as a security guard making minimum wage.

Felicita has had her own convenience store for 5 years and it helps her provide income to the family.  The goods that she sells include sugar, coffee, rice, sweets, oil, and other things.  Before starting this business, she used to work at a tortilla store in the country's capital while tending to the needs of the home.  In addition to the store she runs, she also works raising small animals such as chickens and pigs.  She runs her store from her house and works there every day.

The loan she is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy sugar, rice, beans, detergent, juice, personal hygiene products, etc.  She will take advantage of wholesale supplies so as to obtain better prices on the goods she buys.  This will let her have a surplus in her business, reduce the costs, and in this way obtain greater profits.

Her dream is to set up her own farm of laying chickens and sell the products of the farm at her store.  This would guarantee sustenance for her family and allow her to further develop this activity without having to move to another location far away from her house.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, beans, detergent, juice, and personal hygiene products, among other things.

loans.name: Achima

texts.en:
Achima is 40 years old and lives in a remote region of West Bengal. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband. They have four children. They live in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).  

Achima is illiterate, but knows how to sign her name. Achima could not complete her education due to poverty, but she is willing to provide her children a higher education and desires that her children do not face any obstacles in receiving education. 

Achima’s husband has been associated with agricultural activities for many years. Achima‘s husband's earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household costs for their family. 

Achima’s daughter, Jahanara, is now studying in class X (grade 10) and is very much serious about her studies. In this year, she will appear for her Madhaymik Exam (state board examination). She aims to become a teacher in the future.  

Achima learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan of 15,000 INR for her daughter’s uninterrupted education, so she can take her state board examination without any problem. With the loan amount, Achima will pay the private tuition fee and buy necessary articles like books, notebooks, pens, geometry box, etc. for educational purposes for her daughter. 

Achima and her daughter Jahanara are very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees and buy necessary articles for her daughter’s educational purposes.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
El señor Gerson  de  29  años de edad, vive con su esposa  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur  de Honduras.
Don Gerson tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace  cuatro  años al trabajo como empleado de una finca camaronera, el supervisa el cultivo del camarón. Don Gerson el también fabrica hamacas de hilo y cabuya, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de adobes, cemento, arena, madera y pagar mano de obra.
Don Gerson  con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar su calidad de vida  ya que su casa es pequeña y desea ampliarla en otro lugar. Es su tercer préstamo que solicita es un buen cliente muy puntual en sus pagos.
Su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Gerson, age 29, lives with his wife.  He has two children who are dependent upon her.  He lives in a community in San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras.

Gerson has his own house.  For four years he has been working as an employee on a shrimp farm.  He supervises the shrimp farming.  Gerson also makes hammocks from thread and from sisal plant fibers.

He is requesting the loan to buy adobe, cement, sand, wood, and to pay for labor.  With the support of the loan, he plans to improve his quality of life.  This is because his house is small, and he wishes to expand it in another place.  This is the third loan he has requested.  He is a good client, who is very punctual with his payments.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November, 2013

loans.use: to buy adobe, cement, sand, wood, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracely es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos. De 47 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada. Esta agradecida con MiCredito y kiva por el apoyo brindado a través de este financiamiento ya que logro aumentar su inventario y obtener mayores ingresos. Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y vender joyerías de plata. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar pacas por mayor de ropa usada, zapatos, con el fin de ofrecer una gran cantidad de ropa variada. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya podrá diversificar sus ofertas y adquirir buenas ganancias. Su plan futuro es extender su inventario y su negocio.
texts.en:
Aracely is from the city of Estelí.  She is married and has three children.  She is 47 years old and a merchant by trade.  Her business is selling second-hand clothes.

She is grateful to MiCredito and Kiva for the support provided through this loan.  She managed to increase her inventory and get greater income.  Her goal is to continue investing in her business and to sell silver jewelry.

She is requesting this new loan to buy bundles of used clothes wholesale and shoes.  She will do this in order to offer a great quantity of varied clothing.  She feels that this loan will be very helpful to her because she will be able to diversify her offerings and get good profits.  Her plan for the future is to expand her inventory and her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes wholesale and shoes.

loans.name: Eraste

texts.en:
Eraste is 32 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have three children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs fo maize production and to buy fertilizers. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is 64 years old. He is a father of three children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He has spent seven years in the business.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Thamary

texts.en:
Thamary is a 19-year-old, young woman. She lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at local schools to help improve their learning. Additionally, she offers psychosocial support to young people in her community. Thamary’s hard work and ambition led her to own and run a shop in a local business center, where she sells clothing, accessories and shoes. She started the business in 2011, when she was married and started facing financial difficulties. Currently, Thamary’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.

With a Kiva loan, Thamary will purchase large bales of clothing, to increase her stock and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for herself. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is 37 years old. She is a kind woman. She is a wonderful Tajik woman and she is proud of her nationality. She is married and has four children. Marhabo is a successful businesswoman who has been busy selling children's clothes. She sells her goods in a local market. Marhabo is a sociable woman and thanks to her sociability, she has regular customers. Marhabo is going to increase her working capital as she has a lot of customers. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy children's clothes to sell to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is single with no children. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, and has been in this business for one year. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings(UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of oranges, tomatoes, passion fruits, onions, and yellow bananas. She works in a shop seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to build a residential house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of oranges, tomatoes, passion fruits, onions, and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is an industrious woman. She is a married parent of three children. One of her children is not an adult. Mahbuba has been busy growing agricultural products for more than 11 years. She grows wheat and potatoes. Mahbuba works on her own land. She is the main breadwinner of her family as her husband is a migrant in Russia and doesn’t send enough money. She tries to educate her children and she wants to repair her house because she thinks that her children must live in a house that is in good condition. Mahbuba just finished sowing her land and that’s why she has no money to buy building materials to repair her house. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta de 55  años de edad, tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos, en casa propia vive en una comunidad de  Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Jacinta se dedica desde hace 15 años  negocio de venta de ropa, su actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y tiene dos personas que le venden la mercadería, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que son clientes de hace muchos años.
Doña Jacinta es una persona muy trabajadora y con deseos de casar adelante a su familia, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. ya que se acerca la navidad  y ella tiene varios pedidos y desea hacer negocios, con el apoyo del préstamo mejorara sus ingresos y su negocio crecerá un poco más.
Doña Jacinta su sueño es tener surtido bien su negocio para así tener mejores ganancias.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 55 years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  The live in a community in Nacaome, a valley in the south of Honduras.  For 15 years she has sold clothing as a street vendor, and she has two people from whom she buys her merchandise.  Her customers consist of friends and other people who have been customers for many years.

She is a hardworking person and is motivated to help her family get ahead.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, dresses and other items for her business.  The Christmas season is approaching, and she has many orders she wishes to fill.  With the support of the loan she will be able to increase her income, and her business will grow a little more.

Her dream is to have a well-supplied business so that she can improve her earnings.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2013

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, dresses and other items for her business.

loans.name: Moeurn's Group

texts.en: Moeurn is 55 years old and a mother of six children, but currently has only one daughter under her responsibility. She is a borrower from Battambang province. To feed the family, Moeurn is growing rice on two hectares of farmland and is a paid worker to earn additional income. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns around 23,900 KHR per day. She is a prior borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The prior loan helped to increase her family’s income to provide for her household. This is the seventh time she is borrowing while her group member is borrowing for her fourth time. Now, Moeurn is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR for each member of the group. As the leader, she is going to use her loan to pay for reaping (harvesting) fees. She hopes to earn more income from her business and be able to buy more plots of farmland.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She runs a beauty salon and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. She works in the shop six days every week and sells hair products on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes transportation and unreliable electricity. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, age 35, is a resident of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is married with four children, two of whom are in school. To support her family, she and her husband work as construction workers to earn money. She has been with this business for two years and earns about 10 dollars per day.

She has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now she is leading a group to apply for a new loan of 177,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sinoun is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes her family will have a decent latrine to use to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Eddy Martin

texts.es: Eddy tiene 38 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de la ciudad de Estelí. Casado y padre de un hijo. Se dedica al negocio de Cyber. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que con el financiamiento logro mejorar su calidad de vida obteniendo mayores ingresos de sus ventas. Su meta próxima es seguir aumentando su servicio y la clientela. Solicita el crédito para comprar una fotocopiadora marca Xerox, con el fin de ofrecer servicios nuevos en su negocio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias ya que crecerá su demanda. Su plan futuro es adquirir  máquinas y así tener un cyber bien completo.
texts.en:
Eddy is 38 years old and is originally from the city of Estelí.  He is married and has one son.  He runs an internet cafe.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito, because with his previous loan he was able to increase his sales, which has led to a better quality of life.  His next goal is to continue to expand his services and his customer base.

He is seeking a loan to purchase a Xerox copying machine, with the goal of offering new services in his business.  He believes that the loan will be very helpful and that it will lead to higher earnings, since the demand for this type of service is growing.  His future plan is to acquire more machines and thus have a well-equipped cybercafe.

loans.use: to purchase a Xerox copying machine.

loans.name: Eustasia

texts.en:
Eustasia is a 19-year-old single mother of one, currently living in Hurungwe. She sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts and shoes at the local business center. Eustasia inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their wellbeing, and as an entrepreneur. 

She started the business in 2012 when she finished school so that she can provide for herself. She will use the loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock levels. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming inputs (seed and fertilizer).

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 19 years old. She is married and resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. Betty is known for her voluntary work at community centers. She is a pillar of support for vulnerable children in the community. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, to improve the wellbeing of students. In addition, Betty rents a table at the local flea market, where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now, and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the loan, Betty will increase her stock, by purchasing bags, shoes, and clothing. She hopes to grow the business and open her own store. This would bring stability to her business. Further, it would enable her to secure her further education and to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her flea market table

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 37 years old and lives in Wedza District in eastern Zimbabwe. She has been actively volunteering in and out of schools for the past fifteen years as an early childhood development teacher and community health officer. Cynthia strives to improve the well-being of her community. 

She has had a tobacco farm for the past three years. Her long-term commitment to her community led her to employ four people on her farm. The business has enabled her to survive financial hardships and is critical to her financial security.

With a loan from Kiva, Cynthia will purchase tobacco seeds in bulk. Buying in bulk will reduce delivery costs and help Cynthia increase production. By improving her business, she will be able to create employment opportunities in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 19-year-old single young woman living in Hurungwe, a district in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students life skills education. Hilda inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. 

She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food stuff, such as cooking oils, sugar, salt, mealie-meals (finely ground maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary.
 
Hilda intends to use the loan to stock up on cooking oils, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of the vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, mainly organic, and put a fence around his farm.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is a single mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of roasting green bananas. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings to buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting. 

She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting.

loans.name: Gladis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Gladis, vive junto a su familia, la cual está compuesta por su esposo y sus hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, para ayudar a su esposo con los diferentes gastos familiares fundo su propio negocio que consiste en venta de calzado y ropa, su facilidad es que lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda, trabaja todos los días.
Comprará calzado y vestidos, camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, etc., en variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, con lo que tendrá surtido su inventario para estas épocas en las que las demandas de sus clientes aumentan, espera tener más clientes, mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Sueña con dar a sus hijos el apoyo y la oportunidad para que tengan un estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Gladis lives with her husband and her two children, who are ages 3 and 5.  In order to help her husband with the various family expenses, she started her own business selling clothing and footwear.  It is convenient since she works out of her home.  She works every day of the week.

She will purchase shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, footwear and other items in a variety of colors, sizes and styles in order to supply her store.  Her customer demand is increasing at this time of year.  She hopes to gain more customers, improve her earnings and fulfill her financial obligations.

Her dream is to be able to support her children and give them the opportunity to go to college.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, footwear and other items.

loans.name: Firilient

texts.en:
Firilient is 19 years old and lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. For the last year, Firilient has been volunteering in schools and in her community. She recently became a Camfed Learner Guide, striving to improve the health and wellbeing of her community. 

For the past two years, she has been in the tobacco farming business. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and employ four people on her farm.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk and reduce carriage cost. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pineapples, bananas, plantains, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Lista

texts.en:
Lista is a 21-year-old young woman. She is single and lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Lista has had the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. 

Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2011 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Lista would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Lista will use the Kiva loan to purchase more chemicals, chick feed, broiler concentrate, and fencing to increase production. 

She hopes to put her two children and two cousins through school.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed, broiler concentrate and fencing.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 23 years old, married and a mother of one. She lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe, and is an entrepreneur working with other young women in her rural community, encouraging them to be economically independent. 

She supports her family by selling fish, such as dried kapenta (a small, sardine-like fish) and dried bream in nearby towns. She started her business in 2011 when she started facing financial difficulties, and it has enabled her to support her family and provide for their basic needs. 

Hope knows there is a high demand for the fish she sells. With this Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk at fisheries. This will help boost her profits and enable her to raise enough money to pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Ruth is already an experienced entrepreneur in Wedza District, Zimbabwe with four years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table in the local flea market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. It has enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.  Ruth also volunteers in schools counselling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates. 

With the Kiva loan, Ruth will purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably and take her one step closer to her dream of owning a store one day. This will bring stability to her business that will enable her to secure her children’s education and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her stock in her shop.

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en:
Chiedza is a 20-year-old single mother of one who lives in Wedza district in eastern Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools by organizing clean-up campaigns because she believes that a clean environment offers a healthy and conducive learning environment for children. 

Aside from her involvement with the local community, Chiedza currently runs a poultry business, which she started in June. She produces about 150 broiler chickens every six weeks, and sells them to the local residents in her community. She would very much like to increase her sales in order to expand her business.

The loan will enable her to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost her sales. Improving her business will improve her life considerably, as she will be able to provide for herself and her child.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feeds.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 26-year-old woman, who has two children. She lives in Hurungwe, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges, at a local community center. She currently operates a grocery shop, where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationery. Abigail inspires young women in her community, as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for four years and has managed to employ two people during that time.

Abigail will use the loan to expand her business, by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability, to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Tabeth

texts.en:
Tabeth is 18 years old and a single young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide and an entrepreneur. 

She started her poultry business in January, 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for chickens and saw it as an opportunity. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks, and sells them to local customers.  

Tabeth knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. 

With this loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.  

With a Kiva loan investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is a 20-year-old woman. She has two children, and she lives in Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges, at a local community center in Hurungwe District. She currently operates a grocery shop, where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationery.

She will use the Kiva loan to expand her business, by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability, to better provide for her family’s needs and provide for other vulnerable children in the community. Rejoice inspires young women in her community, as an entrepreneur. She started the business to empower herself economically and earn a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Haawa

texts.en:
Haawa is divorced, with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells fish at the market and has been in this business for ten years. 

Haawa has applied for a loan of UGX 200,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more baskets of fish. She moves door-to-door, seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to own a fully-stocked stall, selling both fresh and dried fish. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila, es soltera, no posee ayuda del extranjero, vive junto a su madre, para cubrir sus gastos personales y los gastos de su hogar ella por iniciativa propia instalo una pupuseria en su casa, la cual atiende de 4:00 p.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m., por el momento esta actividad no le ha representado ningún problema.
Comprará maíz, frijol, chicharrón, repollos, tomates, quesillo y aderezos; estos ingredientes son parte de su materia prima para que el negocio funcione, espera aumentar sus ganancias, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar su servicio.
Anhela ampliar su negocio y  mejorar su economía para darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila is single and does not have help from relatives living abroad.  She lives with her mother.  In order to cover her personal and household expenses, she took the initiative to create a shop in her house selling. She operates the business from 4:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.  So far she has had no major problems. 

She will use the loan funds in order to purchase corn, beans, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and salad dressings. These ingredients are essential for her business.  She hopes to improve her earnings, attract new customers, and improve her level of service.

She wishes to expand her business and help to improve her family's finances and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork, cabbage, tomatoes and salad dressings.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is single with no children, and she doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent. 

She operates a kiosk, and has been in this business for one year. She works in a shop six days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes transportation and on and off electricity. She is aspires to increase her sales to boost her business.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more juice, cooking oil, sweet bananas, biscuits, and boxes of bottled water. .

loans.use: To buy more packed juice, cooking oil, sweet bananas, biscuits, and boxes of bottled water.

loans.name: Enthinia

texts.en:
Enthinia is 35 years old and lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. Enthinia is passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s well-being. 

She rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets for a living. She started the business in 2005 after her husband lost his job. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 

Enthinia intends to use the loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her living standards and to create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is a 23-year-old farmer living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She owns a small scale plot where she has been farming tobacco for the past year. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and support the local community by employing four workers.

The loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield. She intends to use the loan to purchase tobacco seeds in bulk and reduce carriage cost. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 30 years old and a mother of two from the Wedza District, Zimbabwe.  She is currently operating a buy and sell business at a local flea market. She sells cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts. She started the business in January, and has been so successful that she has employed two people. 

When she is not at work, she volunteers at local schools offering counselling services to troubled students and cleaning classrooms. 

Priscilla dreams of being economically independent and opening her own store one day. 

With the requested loan, she intends to purchase additional cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably by bringing her the stability needed to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cell phone minutes, wrist watches, flashlights, toothbrushes, shoes, and waist belts

loans.name: Blanca Liseth

texts.es:
Blanca, es una joven que a su corta edad de 18 años de edad ya tiene su propio hogar, es casada, tiene dos hijos, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras junto a su madre, el negocio ya tiene dos años de estar funcionando, lo atienden de lunes a sábado.
Con el préstamo comprara jocotes, piñas, papayas, pepinos, repollos, cebollas, etc., con lo que surtirá su negocio de productos de mayor calidad, espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, y tener una economía más estable.
Sueña con tener el negocio activo para obtener los ingresos necesarios para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is an 18 year old young woman who already has her own home.  She is married, has two children and sells fruits and vegetables with her mother.  The business is two years old and they work it Monday through Saturday.

She will use the money from this loan to buy plumbs, pineapples, cucumbers, cabbage, onions, etc. so she can stock her business with better quality products, meet her customers’ needs, increase her sales and have better financial stability.

She dreams of having an active business to obtain the necessary income so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elsi Noemy

texts.es:
Elsi, vive en una casa familiar, es soltera no posee ayuda del extranjero, para apoyar con los gastos de la casa ella se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz), por su experiencia no ha tenido ningún problema en realizarla.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas insecticidas, con lo que espera tener una cosecha abundante, granos de mucha calidad, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía y continuar cubriendo parte de los gastos de su hogar.
Anhela mejorar su productividad para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Elsi is single and lives with one of her relatives.  She does not have any help from relatives living abroad.  In order to help with the household expenses, she grows corn.  She has had no problems in doing this.

She will invest in compost, fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides, with the aim of obtaining a good harvest with high-quality crops.  This will lead to increased sales and income, and allow her to continue to cover a portion of the household expenses.

She dreams of increasing her productivity so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, está acompañado, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, no posee ayuda del extranjero, para cubrir los gastos de su familia se dedica a vender ropa, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., por el momento no le ha representado ninguna dificultad realizarla.
Invertirá en la compra de variedad de ropa como: blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, calzonetas, con lo que surtirá el negocio para estas fechas de fin de año que es cuando aumenta sus demandas, espera aumentar sus ingresos, tener más clientes satisfechos y cancelar con responsabilidad la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio mucho más fortalecido que le dé más ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and is the father of two children, ages 8 and 9 and doesn’t get any outside assistance to cover the family expenses.  He sells clothing from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm and he has not had any difficulties to date.

He will buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, and undergarments to stock his store for the end of year season, when his customer demand goes up.  He hopes to increase his income, have more customers, and pay off the loan responsibly.  He wants to have a stronger business that will provide more earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.ru: Саадат 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Саадат - средне-специальное образование, сразу после окончания школы Саадат поступила в товароведческий техникум, окончила техникум в 1986 году и проработала в магазине в сфере торговли 1 год. Затем Саадат вышла замуж за Тулебека и после распада Союза они начали заниматься сельским хозяйством, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Саадат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 35 овец, а также 2,0 ГА поливной земли на которой они выращивают клевер и фасоль. Супруг и сын Саадат работают в лесхозе и имеют ежемесячную зарплату. Саадат занимается домашним хозяйством. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саадат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Саадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение младшей дочери.
texts.en: Saadat is 46 years old, married, and raising four children. Saadat has a vocational education. After graduation, Saadat entered merchandising college, graduated from college in 1986 and worked in a trade shop for one year. Then, Saadat married Tulebek.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, they started farming, having purchased cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Saadat's hard work, her farm now has 2 dairy cows, 35 sheep, and 2 hectares of irrigated land on which they grow clover and beans. Saadat's husband and son work in forestry and have a monthly salary. Saadat is a housekeeper.  Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to further grow her household, Saadat has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan - for the purchase of cattle for cattle breeding. Saadat plans to invest the loan income into increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save money to pay for the education of her younger daughter.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Audelia Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Audelia es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Mi Crédito ya que ha logrado surtir sus productos y aumentar las ventas. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz empacado, Azúcar, Aceite entre otros; con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Audelia is originally from the city of Granada. She is a merchant by trade and manages a grocery business.

Audelia is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she will be able to restock with more products and increase her sales. She is requesting a new loan so that she can buy products such as packaged rice, sugar, oil, and other products. In the end, she hopes to meet the demand of her customers.

Audelia believes the loan will be of great help because she will be able to generate better earnings and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy packaged rice, sugar, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар 52 года, вдова, одна воспитала сына. Сыну 26 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей проживает вместе с Чынар и помогает ей по хозяйству. У Чынар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынар занимается животноводством, стартовав 1 год назад, с покупки коровы на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок. Корова в день дает 15 литров молока, Чынар ежедневно сдает реализаторам по 20 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Также сын помогает матери материально. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynar is a 52 year old widow, who has raised one son by herself. Her son is 26 years old, married and has 2 children.  He lives with Chynar and helps her with the housework. Chynar has a secondary education. In order to make money to support the family, Chynar raises livestock. She started one year ago, with the purchase of a cow for 50,000 KGS. Thanks to Chynar's hard work, today she has one dairy cow and one bull. The cow gives 15 liters of milk per day. Every day, Chynar gives dairy processers 20 KGS. The monthly income from the sale of milk is 9,000 KGS. Her son also helps her financially. In order to further grow her business, Chynar has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of sheep for fattening and re-selling. Chynar plans to invest the loan income in further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and intends to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dadokhon

texts.ru:
Дадохону из района Исфары 35 лет. У него большая семья, состоящая из родителей, сестры, брата и жены. Дадохон женат на Зухро. Ей 32 года. Брат Дадохона живет и работает за приделами страны, он уехал, чтобы прокормить свою семью. 
  Дадохон до недавних пор нигде не работал. Он решил начать свой бизнес, точнее открыть собственный продуктовый магазин. Дадохон ответственно относится к своей будущей деятельности и по фотографии можно увидеть, что он уже обустроил свой магазин, построил полки и купил холодильник. Но для закупа первого товара ему не хватает средств. Он обратился за помощью с большой надеждой на Вашу поддержку. Он очень верит, что ему помогут. Дадохон хочет сам зарабатывать, кормить свою большую семью и стать ответственным отцом.
texts.en: Dadokhon is 35 years old and from the Isfara district. He has a large family, consisting of parents, sister, brother and his wife. Dadokhon is married to Zuhro. She is 32 years old. Dadokhon's brother lives and works abroad in order to feed his family. Until recently, Dadokhon did not work. He decided to start a business, specifically, open his own grocery store. Dadokhon has a responsible attitude towards his future business and photos show that he has set up his shop, built shelves and bought a refrigerator. However, he lacks the funds for the purchase of his first merchandise. He has asked for help with great hope for your support. He strongly believes that he can be helped. Dadokhon wants to earn money to feed his large family and be a responsible father.

loans.use: To open a grocery store and purchase the first merchandise

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married with two children living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a learner guide volunteering at schools in her community. 

Over the past two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2010 when her family began to face financial difficulties.

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Angeline would very much like to increase her sales volumes and become a supplier to major supermarkets. 

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and put them through school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бурул - среднее образование, по характеру Бурул очень целеустремленная, предприимчивая, неустанно трудится во благо своей семьи. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурул занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Старший сын Бурул работает в столице Кыргызстана, помогает семье материально. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Burul is 45 years old, married, and raising three children. Burul has a secondary education.  By nature Burul is very purposeful and resourceful, working tirelessly for the benefit of her family. As the main income for her family, Burul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 19 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Burul's hard work, her farm now has 2 dairy cows. Burul's eldest son works in the Kyrgyz capital and helps the family financially. Burul's monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further grow her business, Burul has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan for the purchase of steers to increase the amount livestock. Burul plans to invest the loan income in further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to pay for higher education for her children.

loans.use: to buy gobies

loans.name: Ligia Tatiana

texts.es:
Ligia, es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, ella es soltera y no posee otro tipo de ingreso más el que ella genera con la crianza y venta de pollos, es una actividad que e inicio por cuenta propia debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para los gastos familiares.
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra de pollos, concentrado y malla, con lo que fortalecerá el negocio y mejorara la infraestructura del mismo, espera aumentar la producción, tener mejores ventas y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Sueña con fortalecer poco a poco el negocio y dar a sus hijos mejor salud, educación, alimentación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Ligia is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. She is single and has no other type of income other than what she earns raising and selling chickens. It is an activity that she started on her own because of the need to generate income for household expenses.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of chickens, animal feed and wire mesh which will strengthen the business and improve its infrastructure. She hopes to increase production to have better sales and higher earnings.

She dreams of strengthening the business little by little and offering her children better health, education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed and wire mesh.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members apart from her children. 

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and begin going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El señor Eloy tiene 41 años, casado con un hijo que tiene la edad de 18 años, él trabaja como en una entidad pública como policía, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Eloy va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que el señor Eloy tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Eloy, age 41, is married and has an 18 year old son.  Eloy works as a public employee as a policeman.  This is his first loan with the institution.  Eloy is going to use the loan to finish installing water in his home.  They only have a well, and it is a lot of work transporting the water.  He will build a connection for the bathrooms, shower, and kitchen.  This way he will provide his family with greater comfort.  There are many reasons that the area where he lives does not have basic services.  However, this will not stop Eloy from having potable water in his home.  He is very happy for the opportunity provided to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing water in his home.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул опытная и умелая швея. Она продолжает свое швейное дело и сейчас повторно обращается за кредитом. Первый кредит она брала на покупку тканей. Теперь она на сумму второго кредита хочет купить себе новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Ее собственная швейная машинка очень устарела и по этой причине процесс ее работы идет медленно. Мавчигул решила расширить свою деятельность. С помощью новой машинки она сможет брать больше заказов на шитье платьев и ей будет помогать дочь. Она верит, что и в этот раз Кредиторы Kiva поддержат ее.
texts.en: Mavchigul is an experienced and skilled seamstress. She continues to sew and now again would like to take a loan. She took her first loan to buy fabric. Now she would like to take a second loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine. Her own sewing machine is very old and for this reason her work goes slowly. Mavchigul decided to expand her business. With the aid of a new sewing machine she will be able to take larger orders to sew dresses and her daughter can help her. She believes that this time Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Fungisai

texts.en:
Fungisayi is 21 years old and a single mother of one. She lives in eastern Zimbabwe in Wedza District. 

She currently operates a takeaway food shop from a shack at the Wedza Center. She offers a menu that includes sadza (cornmeal), rice, beef, vegetables, chicken, and fish and chips.
